$(l)Agriculture$() encompasses $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(), berries and other crop related items added by Cobblemon.
book.cobblepedia.categories.apricorn.des: In $(l)apricorn$() is a plant that grows in a variety of colors on $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_tree)apricorn trees$(). They are used to craft most $(l:cobblepedia:poke_balls)Poké Balls$().
$(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Archaeology)Archaeology$() gives the player the opportunity to find, inside archaeological $(l:structures)structures$(), Pokémon-themed items, get $(l:tumblestones)Tumblestones$() for crafting $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Balls$() and bring $(l:fossil)fossils$() back to life with a $(l:resurrection_machine)Restoration Machine$().
book.cobblepedia.categories.cobblemon_ad: You can install mods that adds features to cobblemon, just like the one that adds this book. You can find addons at $(l:https://discord.com/channels/934267676354834442/1037840446916935750)Cobblemon's Discord$().
book.cobblepedia.categories.commands.des: $(l)Commands$() are text actions that can be used to activate features in game.$(br2)These commands are not essential for normal gameplay and will require cheats to be enabled to be used.
$(l)Consumables$() are items that can be used on a Pokémon or consumed by the player.
book.cobblepedia.categories.evolution_it: An $(l)Evolution item$() is an item that allows certain Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$(). Depending on the Pokémon and the item, the Pokémon may need to hold the item, or the item may be able to be used directly.
book.cobblepedia.categories.getting_star: $(l)Pokémon$() are entities that can be $(l:cobblepedia:pokemon_spawning)found$() across all biomes at varying levels. They can be caught by players using $(l:cobblepedia:poke_balls)Poké Balls$() and can be used to $(l:cobblepedia:battling)battle$() other Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.categories.held_items.d: $(l)Held items$() are a series of items to be held by Pokémon. When held, these items will give Pokémon certain buffs or effects in battle.
book.cobblepedia.categories.items.descri: $(l)Items$() and $(l)Blocks$() added by Cobblemon.$(br2)Start typing to search!
book.cobblepedia.categories.poke_balls.d: A $(l)Poké Ball$() is a tool used for $(l:cobblepedia:catching)catching$() and storing caught Pokémon. $(br2)There are 48 variants of Poké Balls, 46 of which are obtainable via crafting.
book.cobblepedia.categories.pokemon.desc: $(l)Pokémon$() are entities that can be $(l:pokemon_spawning)found$() across all biomes at varying levels. They can be caught by players using $(l:poke_balls)Poké Balls$() and can be used to $(l:battling)battle$() other Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.categories.structures.d: This category lists all Cobblemon structures that can generate throughout the world.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ability_capsule: The Ability Capsule currently cannot be obtained through regular means. However, it can be found in the Creative inventory, or using commands.
$(l)Ability Capsules$() are a $(l:medicine)medicine$() that changes the ability of the Pokémon it is used on to their alternative standard ability.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ability_patch.o: The Ability Patch currently cannot be obtained through regular means. However, it can be found in the Creative inventory, or using commands.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ability_patch.t: $(l)Ability Patch$() are a medicine that changes the ability of the Pokémon it is used on to their alternative hidden ability.
An $(l)Ability Shield$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that prevents the holder's ability from being changed or suppressed by any effect.
book.cobblepedia.entries.absorb_bulb.loo: Absorb Bulbs can be found within $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$() inside of $(l:prehistoric_lush_den)Prehistoric Lush Dens$(), $(l:prehistoric_mossy_pond)Prehistoric Mossy Ponds$() and $(l:prehistoric_mud_pit)Prehistoric Mud Pit$() $(l:structures)structures$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.absorb_bulb.tex: An $(l)Absorb Bulb$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that raises the holder's Special Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Water-type move.
book.cobblepedia.entries.adamant_mint.te: $(l)Adamant Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Attack stat and decrease it's Special Attack stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Adamant nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.air_balloon.tex: An $(l)Air Balloon$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that causes the holder to be ungrounded, meaning that they cannot be affected by damaging Ground-type moves and any other ground-related effects. If the holder is hit by a damaging move, the Air Balloon will pop, removing its effects. The item itself, however, will not be destroyed and will return to normal once the battle ends.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_azure_b: As with the other 6 basic Ancient Poké Balls, it is relatively easy to make, requiring 2 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(), 2 $(l:tumblestone)tumblestones$() and a copper ingot to craft.
An $(l)Ancient Azure Ball$() is one of the 7 basic $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Balls$(), equivalent to a $(l:azure_ball)Azure Ball$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_azure_r: Is a $(l:ancient_azure_ball)ancient azure ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_balls.o: All Ancient Poké Balls must be crafted or found in $(l:ruin_structure)ruins$(). This is not planned to change.$(br2)The $(l:ancient_origin_ball)Ancient Origin Ball$() is currently unobtainable in survival gameplay and can only be obtained through Creative Mode or commands. It can freely be used for any purpose, such as for event distributions on servers.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_balls.t: An $(l)Ancient Poké Ball$() is a tool used for $(l:catching)catching$() and storing caught Pokémon. There are 16 variants of Ancient Poké Balls, 1 of which is currently unobtainable in survival.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_balls.u: Variants with different weights that makes them fly further or not as far as other $(l:poke_balls)Poké balls$().

Ancient Poké Balls are no different in usage than $(l:poke_balls)regular Poké Balls$(). The core difference lies in their crafting; all Ancient Poké Balls require one of the 3 types of $(l:tumblestones)Tumblestone$() to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_citrine: As with the other 6 basic Ancient Poké Balls, it is relatively easy to make, requiring 2 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(), 2 $(l:tumblestone)tumblestones$() and a copper ingot to craft.
An $(l)Ancient Citrine Ball$() is one of the 7 basic $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Balls$(), equivalent to a $(l:citrine_ball)Citrine Ball$().
Is a $(l:ancient_citrine_ball)ancient citrine ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_feather: Unlike the basic Ancient Poké Balls, Ancient Feather Balls requires a $(l:blue_apricorn)blue apricorn$(), a $(l:white_apricorn)white apricorn$() and $(l:sky_tumblestone)Sky Tumblestones$() instead of $(l:tumblestone)regular tumblestones$() to craft.

An $(l)Ancient Feather Ball$() is a first $(l:poke_ball_tiers)tier$() $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Ball$().$(br2)It functions similarly to the $(l:ancient_poke_ball)Ancient Poké Ball$(), but is capable of being thrown further.
Is a $(l:ancient_feather_ball)ancient feather ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_gigaton: Unlike first and second tier Ancient Poké Balls, Ancient Gigaton Balls require a gold ingot, 2 $(l:black_apricorn)black apricorns$() and $(l:black_tumblestone)Black Tumblestones$() instead of $(l:tumblestone)regular tumblestones$() to craft.

An $(l)Ancient Gigaton Ball$() is a third $(l:poke_ball_tiers)tier$() $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Ball$().$(br2)It functions similarly to the $(l:ancient_ultra_ball)Ancient Ultra Ball$(), but does not throw as far.
Is a $(l:ancient_gigaton_ball)ancient gigaton ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_great_b: Unlike first tier Ancient Poké Balls, Ancient Great Balls require an iron ingot, a $(l:red_apricorn)red apricorn$() and a $(l:blue_apricorn)blue apricorn$() to craft.
An $(l)Ancient Great Ball$() is a second $(l:poke_ball_tiers)tier$() $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Ball$(), equivalent to a $(l:great_ball)Great Ball$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_great_r: Is a $(l:ancient_great_ball)ancient great ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_heavy_b: Unlike Ancient Poké Balls, Ancient Heavy Balls require 2 $(l:black_apricorn)black apricorns$() and $(l:black_tumblestone)Black Tumblestones$() instead of $(l:tumblestone)regular tumblestones$() to craft.

An $(l)Ancient Heavy Ball$() is a first $(l:poke_ball_tiers)tier$() $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Ball$().$(br2)It functions similarly to the $(l:ancient_poke_ball)Ancient Poké Ball$(), but does not throw as far.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_heavy_r: Is a $(l:ancient_heavy_ball)ancient heavy ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_ivory_b: As with the other 6 basic Ancient Poké Balls, it is relatively easy to make, requiring 2 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(), 2 $(l:tumblestone)tumblestones$() and a copper ingot to craft.
An $(l)Ancient Ivory Ball$() is one of the 7 basic $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Balls$(), equivalent to a $(l:premier_ball)Premier Ball$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_ivory_r: Is a $(l:ancient_ivory_ball)ancient ivory ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_jet_bal: Unlike first and second tier Ancient Poké Balls, Ancient Jet Balls require a gold ingot, a $(l:blue_apricorn)blue apricorn$(), a $(l:white_apricorn)white apricorn$() and $(l:sky_tumblestone)Sky Tumblestones$() instead of $(l:tumblestone)regular tumblestones$() to craft.

An $(l)Ancient Jet Balls$() is a third $(l:poke_ball_tiers)tier$() $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Ball$().$(br2)It functions similarly to the $(l:ancient_ultra_ball)Ancient Ultra Ball$(), but is capable of being thrown further.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_jet_rod: Is a $(l:ancient_jet_ball)ancient jet ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_leaden_: Unlike first tier Ancient Poké Balls, Ancient Leaden Balls require an iron ingot, 2 $(l:black_apricorn)black apricorns$() and $(l:black_tumblestone)Black Tumblestones$() instead of $(l:tumblestone)regular tumblestones$() to craft.

An $(l)Ancient Leaden Ball$() is a second $(l:poke_ball_tiers)tier$() $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Ball$().$(br2)It functions similarly to the $(l:ancient_great_ball)Ancient Great Ball$(), but does not throw as far.
Is a $(l:ancient_leaden_ball)ancient leaden ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_origin_: Unlike other $(l:poke_balls)Poké Balls$(), the Ancient Origin Ball is not craftable or obtainable in normal gameplay.

An $(l)Ancient Origin Ball$() is an untiered Poké Ball.$(br2)Despite appearances resembling the $(l:cherish_ball)Cherish Ball$(), the Ancient Origin Ball functions more similar to the $(l:master_ball)Master Ball$(), having a 100% catch rate, meaning it will never fail to catch a Pokémon.
Is a $(l:ancient_origin_ball)ancient origin ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_poke_ba: As with the other 6 basic Ancient Poké Balls, it is relatively easy to make, requiring 2 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(), 2 $(l:tumblestone)tumblestones$() and a copper ingot to craft.
An $(l)Ancient Poké Ball$() is one of the 7 basic $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Balls$(), equivalent to a $(l:poke_ball)Poké Ball$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_poke_ro: Is a $(l:ancient_poke_ball)ancient poke ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_roseate: As with the other 6 basic Ancient Poké Balls, it is relatively easy to make, requiring 2 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(), 2 $(l:tumblestone)tumblestones$() and a copper ingot to craft.
An $(l)Ancient Roseate Ball$() is one of the 7 basic $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Balls$(), equivalent to a $(l:roseate_ball)Roseate Ball$().
Is a $(l:ancient_roseate_ball)ancient roseate ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_slate_b: As with the other 6 basic Ancient Poké Balls, it is relatively easy to make, requiring 2 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(), 2 $(l:tumblestone)tumblestones$() and a copper ingot to craft.
An $(l)Ancient Slate Ball$() is one of the 7 basic $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Balls$(), equivalent to a $(l:slate_ball)Slate Ball$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_slate_r: Is a $(l:ancient_slate_ball)ancient slate ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_ultra_b: Unlike first and second tier Ancient Poké Balls, Ancient Ultra Balls require a gold ingot, $(l:yellow_apricorn)yellow apricorn$() and a $(l:black_apricorn)black apricorn$() to craft.
An $(l)Ancient Ultra Ball$() is a third $(l:poke_ball_tiers)tier$() $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Ball$(), equivalent to a $(l:ultra_ball)Ultra Ball$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_ultra_r: Is a $(l:ancient_ultra_ball)ancient ultra ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_verdant: As with the other 6 basic Ancient Poké Balls, it is relatively easy to make, requiring 2 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(), 2 $(l:tumblestone)tumblestones$() and a copper ingot to craft.
An $(l)Ancient Verdant Ball$() is one of the 7 basic $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Balls$(), equivalent to a $(l:verdant_ball)Verdant Ball$().
Is a $(l:ancient_verdant_ball)ancient verdant ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_wing_ba: Unlike first tier Ancient Poké Balls, Ancient Wing Balls require an iron ingot, a $(l:blue_apricorn)blue apricorn$(), a $(l:white_apricorn)white apricorn$() and $(l:sky_tumblestone)Sky Tumblestones$() instead of $(l:tumblestone)regular tumblestones$() to craft.

An $(l)Ancient Wing Balls$() is a second $(l:poke_ball_tiers)tier$() $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Ball$().$(br2)It functions similarly to the $(l:ancient_great_ball)Ancient Great Ball$(), but is capable of being thrown further.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ancient_wing_ro: Is a $(l:ancient_wing_ball)ancient wing ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.antidote.text: An $(l)Antidote$() is a type of $(l:brew#spray)status condition healing medicine$() that cures a Pokémon from poison when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn.aprico: Apricorns can be used to craft Bowls
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn.compos: Putting an apricorn in a composter has a 65%% chance of raising the compost level by 1.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn.farmin: Apricorns have 4 stages of growth. During its first stage, the bud is small and black. In its second and third stages, the bud becomes progressively larger and lighter brown. Finally, in its last stage, the Apricorn will grow to its largest size and reflect the color of apricorn that it will yield.
Apricorns, on average, take one Minecraft day to go from their first stage to their last stage. Bone meal can be used on a growing apricorn to automatically progress to the next stage in its growth.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn.obtain: Apricorns can be found growing naturally on $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_tree)apricorn trees$(). Harvesting with one when fully grown will yield a single apricorn item and will leave behind an apricorn bud in its first growth stage.$(br)Apricorns can be harvested by powering a Redstone dispenser containing shears.$(br)$(l:apricorn_seed)Apricorn seeds$() have a 10%% chance of dropping when an apricorn is harvested.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn.text: An $(l)apricorn$() is a plant that grows in a variety of $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn#colors)colors$() on $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_tree)apricorn trees$(). They are used to craft most $(l:cobblepedia:poke_balls)Poké Balls$().
The seven $(l)Apricorn Poké Balls$() are a set of $(l)Poké Balls$() based on the seven $(l)apricorn$() colors.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_boat.t: An $(l)apricorn boat$() is a drivable vehicle entity used primarily for fast transport of players and passenger mobs over bodies of water.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_button: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
An $(l)apricorn button$() is a block that can be used to send out a Redstone signal when a player interacts with it or when a projectile hits it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_chest_: An $(l)Apricorn Boat with Chest$() is a single chest occupying the passenger seat of a boat, and functions as such.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_door.c: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_door.t: An $(l)apricorn door$() is a building block that can be right-clicked and opened or activated with Redstone, allowing a player or entity to pass through.
This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
An $(l)apricorn fence$() is a building block that cannot be jumped over, as it is 1.5 blocks in height.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_fence_: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
An $(l)apricorn fence gate$() is a building block that cannot be jumped over, as it is 1.5 blocks in height.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_hangin: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
An $(l)apricorn hanging sign$() is a block that can display text.$(br2)Like any other hanging sign, the apricorn hanging sign can be placed on the bottom or sides of a block.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_leaves: Apricorn leaves can be obtained with shears or tools enchanted with Silk Touch.$(br)Hoes are the default tool for breaking apricorn leaves.
Apricorn leaves can be used in the Composter block, these have the same chance to raise the compost pile the Minecraft leaves do.
Apricorn leaves can be found generated as part of apricorn trees throughout the world.$(br)As well, they generate as part of any apricorn trees grown via $(l:apricorn_seed)apricorn seeds$(/l).

Unlike all other leaf blocks in Minecraft, apricorn leaves do not have any drops if broken without shears or Silk Touch. This is mainly due to the fact that the sapling type for an apricorn tree is obtained via the $(l:apricorn)apricorn$(/l) plant, rather than the leaves of the tree.
$(l)Apricorn leaves$() are blocks that generate naturally as a part of $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_tree)apricorn trees$(/l).
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_log.te: The $(l)apricorn log$() is a naturally occurring block that generates in the world as a part of $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_tree)apricorn trees$(/l). Apricorn logs can be obtained by growing $(l:apricorn_seed)apricorn saplings$(/l).
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_planks: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
$(l)Apricorn planks$() are a building block used in a wide variety of crafting recipes.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_pressu: An apricorn pressure plate is a block that can be used to send out a Redstone signal when an entity stands on it.
An $(l)apricorn pressure plate$() is a block that can be used to send out a Redstone signal when an entity stands on it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_seed.c: Apricorn sprouts comes in 7 different colors.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_seed.o: Apricorn sprouts have a 12.5%% chance to drop alongside $(l:apricorn)apricorns$() when harvested.$(br2)Any of the seven types of apricorn sprouts can also be found inside village house chests.$(br2)If you choose to play with the bonus chest enabled, apricorn sprouts can be found inside.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_seed.t: $(l)Apricorn sprouts$() are $(l:items)items$() that can be planted on dirt or grass blocks as apricorn saplings.$(br2)An apricorn sapling is the resulting $(l:items)block$() that can be grown into one of the seven types of $(l:apricorn_tree)apricorn tree$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_seed.u: Apricorn sprouts can be planted directly on $(l:apricorn_leaves)Apricorn leaves$() to create a new Apricorn of the same color.$(br2)Bone meal can be used on a planted apricorn sapling to speed up its growth.$(br2)Putting an apricorn sprout in a composter has a 65%% chance of raising the compost level by 1.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_set.te: The $(l)apricorn wood set$() is a collection of building blocks that can be crafted using $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_log)apricorn logs$().$(br)This wood set is associated with $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_tree)apricorn trees$(/l).
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_sign.c: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_sign.t: An $(l)apricorn sign$() is a block that can display text.$(br2)Like any other sign, the apricorn sign can be placed on the top or sides of a block.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_slab.c: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_slab.t: $(l)Apricorn slabs$() are a building block. They are a half-height version of apricorn planks.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_stairs: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.

$(l)Apricorn stairs$() are a building block that allows a player or entity to move up or down a block without jumping. Like any other stair type, can be connected, flipped, and rotated to create a variety of patterns.$(br)This block shares all of the same properties as apricorn planks such as hardness and resistance.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_trapdo: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
An $(l)apricorn trapdoor$() is a building block that acts as a 1x1 door. It can be right-clicked and opened or activated with Redstone, allowing a player or entity to pass through.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_tree.g: All apricorn trees generate with a single type of apricorn, of which it will have an indeterminate amount growing on it.$(br)Apricorn trees will rarely generate in the world on any available grass block, regardless of biome. However, in order to generate or grow, apricorn trees require a 1x1 column of 5 empty blocks.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_tree.o: The items above can be obtained from any variant of apricorn tree.
The items above can only be obtained from the corresponding color of apricorn tree.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_tree.t: An $(l)apricorn tree$() is a type of tree that can rarely be found in any biome.$(br)These trees are the only method of obtaining and farming $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(/l).
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_wood.c: This block does not currently generate naturally anywhere in the world and must be crafted to be obtained.
book.cobblepedia.entries.apricorn_wood.t: $(l)Apricorn wood$() is a building block crafted from apricorn logs. It possesses the log's bark texture on all six sides.
book.cobblepedia.entries.armor_fossil.te: $(l)Armor Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Shieldon$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_eroded_pillar)Eroded Pillar$(), $(l:prehistoric_lush_den)Lush Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_mud_pit)Mud Pit$(), $(l:prehistoric_powdered_deposit)Powdered Deposit$(), $(l:prehistoric_sandy_den)Sandy Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_den)Sunscorched Den$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.assault_vest.ho: An $(l)Assault Vest$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that raises the Special Defense of the Pokémon holding it by 50%%, but prevents the holder from selecting any status move.$(br)If the holder is restricted to using only status moves and cannot use any other moves, the holder will be forced to use Struggle instead.
book.cobblepedia.entries.assault_vest.te: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This offensive vest boosts the holder's Sp. Def stat but prevents the use of status moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.auspicious_armo: $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Bastion_Remnant)Bastion remnant$() chests may contain Auspicious Armor.

A $(l)Auspicious Armor$() is an $(l:evolution_items)evolution item$() that is used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Charcadet$() into $(pokemon)Armarouge$(). Using it consumes the Auspicious Armor. It is a counterpart to $(l:malicious_armor)Malicious Armor$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.automaton_armor: Automaton variation of the $(l:smithing_template)Pokémon-themed armor trims$().
The Automaton Armor Trim is based on $(pokemon)Golett$() and $(pokemon)Golurk$()'s patterns. The name is also in reference to their Pokémon Category, being the Automaton Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.awakening.text: An $(l)Awakening$() is a type of $(l:brew#spray)status condition healing medicine$() that wakes a Pokémon from sleep when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.azure_ball.craf: As with the other 6 $(l:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l), it is relatively easy to make, requiring 4 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(/l) and a copper ingot to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.azure_ball.text: An Azure Ball is one of the 7 $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l) needed for the A Full Palette advancement.$(br)It is one of the 5 original Poké Balls created for Cobblemon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.azure_rod.name: Azure Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.azure_rod.text: Is a $(l:azure_ball)azure ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.basic_balls.cra: Basic Poké Balls are relatively easy to make, requiring 4 like-color $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn)apricorns$() and a copper ingot to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.basic_balls.tex: The seven $(l)Basic Poké Balls$() are a set of $(l:cobblepedia:poke_balls)Poké Balls$() made with one of the seven $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn#colors)apricorn colors$().
Small bamboo rafts appear when a Pokémon that can't swim is sent out into the water.
book.cobblepedia.entries.battling.text: You can battle wild Pokémon by pressing $(k:cobblemon.throwpartypokemon) while looking at them.
book.cobblepedia.entries.battling_player: You can spectate other people's battles by pressing $(k:cobblemon.throwpartypokemon) while looking at any player that is battling.
You can battle other people by pressing $(k:cobblemon.throwpartypokemon) while looking at them.
book.cobblepedia.entries.beast_ball.craf: Unlike first, second, or third tier Poké Balls, Beast Balls require a diamond and a specific pattern of echo shards and gold ingots to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.beast_ball.text: A Beast Ball is a fourth tier Poké Ball.$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.beast_rod.name: Beast Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.beast_rod.text: Is a $(l:beast_ball)beast ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.berry.obtaining: $(l)Berries$() are obtained from harvesting a $(l:berry_tree)berry tree$(), of which can be found around your world, each give you a selected amount per yield. There are 30 $(l:natural_berry)natural berries$() and 39 $l:mutated_berry)mutation berries$(), which can be obtained by crossbreeding.
book.cobblepedia.entries.berry.text: A $(l)berry$() is a status item for Pokémon that provides an effect in or outside of battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.berry.usage: They can be used in brewing stands to get a variety of $(l:medicine)medical items$() such as potions. Berries can also be used to craft $(l:vitamin)vitamins$() and $(l:x_stat)X-stats$(). As of the 1.4 update "Friends and Farms", there is no cooldown or limit to using berries outside of battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.berry_juice.cra: Crafted with a bowl and two of any $(l:berry)berry$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.berry_juice.tex: $(l)Berry Juice$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that restores 20 HP when a Pokémon holding the item falls below 50%% HP.
If the player wishes to get into more advanced $(l:berry)berry$() farming, they can plant certain $(l:berry_tree)berry trees$() next to each other to get $(l:mutated_berry)mutated berries$(). With each harvest, berry trees have a 12.5%% chance to produce mutated berries instead of normal berries, if conditions are met. It's important to note that berries you plan to mutate must be next to each other and not diagonal.
Mutation trees that shows what combinations of $(l:berry_tree)berry trees$() are necessary to create $(l:mutated_berry)mutated berries$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.berry_sweet.tex: A berry-shaped sweet. When a $(pokemon)Milcery$() holds this, it spins around happily.
book.cobblepedia.entries.berry_tree.farm: There are 4 stages of berry trees that indicate it's age; When the plant is fully grown, it will produce flowers that eventually turn into berries. When harvested, the flowers will grow back $(o)$(t:the time of which depends on the berry type)over time$().$(br)Additionally, there are several types of $(l:mulch)mulch$() that can be used on berry plants at $(o)$(t:before they sprout)stage 0$() to get a variety of effects. The player can use two bone meal on a fully mature berry plant to instantly replenish the berries.
book.cobblepedia.entries.berry_tree.gene: Biome Location for $(l:natural_berry)Natural Berries$() and Preferred $(l:mulch)Mulch$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.berry_tree.text: $(l)Berry Trees$() are a type of plant that yields the player $(l:berry)berries$() when ready to harvest. The 17 naturally spawning trees can be found in specific biomes, with villages occasionally having a Berry farm in place of a normal one.
book.cobblepedia.entries.big_root.farmin: When planted below any stone or dirt-like block, Big Roots have a chance to spread underneath adjacent stone or dirt-like blocks. These new roots can be harvested, and a newly spawned root has a 1/4th chance to be an $(l:energy_root)energy root$().$(br)When bone meal is used on a root, it will force the root to spread and create a new one.
book.cobblepedia.entries.big_root.genera: Big Roots can be found spawning in small clusters hanging from the ceilings of caves above the deepslate layer. They can be found in any biome, and they spawn more frequently near y=62.
book.cobblepedia.entries.big_root.obtain: Breaking will always yield a single Big Root. It can be instantly mined with any tool.
book.cobblepedia.entries.big_root.text: A $(l)Big Root$() is a $(l:crop)crop$() that can be found growing from the ceilings of caves near the surface. It doubles as a $(l:held_items)held item$() that increases the health gained from draining moves by 30%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.binding_band.te: A $(l)Binding Band$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that causes binding moves used by the holder to inflict 1/6 of the target's health instead of the usual 1/8 of the target's health at the end of each turn.
$(l)Black Augurite$() is an item that can be used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Scyther$() into $(pokemon)Kleavor$().
A glassy black stone that produces a sharp cutting edge when split. It's loved by a certain Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.black_belt.hold: A Black Belt is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Fighting-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.black_belt.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This belt helps with focus and boosts the power of the holder's Fighting-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.black_gilded_ch: A $(l)Black Gilded Chest$() is the $(l:black_apricorn)black apricorn$() $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn#colors)color$() variation of a $(l:gilded_chest)gilded chest$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.black_glasses.h: $(l)Black Glasses$() are a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Dark-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.black_glasses.t: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a pair of shady- looking glasses that boost the power of the holder's Dark-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.black_sludge.ho: A $(l)Black Sludge$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that heals Poison-types by 1/16 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn. If the holder is not a Poison-type Pokémon, it will lose 1/8 of its maximum HP instead.
book.cobblepedia.entries.black_sludge.te: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If the holder is a Poison type, this sludge will gradually restore its HP. It damages any other type.
book.cobblepedia.entries.black_tumblesto: $(l)Black tumblestone$() is the black $(l:tumblestones)tumblestone$() variant. Becomes a $(l:black_tumblestone_cluster)black tumblestone bud$() when placed.
$(l)Block of black tumblestone$() is the black $(l:tumblestone_blocks)tumblestone block$() variant.
$(l)Black Tumblestone Brick Slab$() is one of the $(l:tumblestone_brick_slabs)tumblestone brick slabs$().
$(l)Black Tumblestone Brick Stairs$() is one of the $(l:tumblestone_bricks_stairs)tumblestone brick stairs$().
$(l)Black Tumblestone Brick Wall$() is one of the $(l:tumblestone_brick_walls)tumblestone brick walls$().
$(l)Black Tumblestone Bricks$() is one of the $(l:tumblestones_bricks)tumblestone bricks$().
$(l)Black tumblestone cluster$() is the black $(l:tumblestone_clusters)tumblestone cluster$() variant. Drops $(l:black_tumblestone)black tumblestones$() when fully grown.
book.cobblepedia.entries.blue_gilded_che: A $(l)Blue Gilded Chest$() is the $(l:blue_apricorn)blue apricorn$() $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn#colors)color$() variation of a $(l:gilded_chest)gilded chest$().
$(l)Blue Mint Leaf$() is a $(l:mint_leaf)mint leaf$() that can influence a Pokémon's defense stat. Grows from $(l:blue_mint_seeds)blue mint seeds$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.blue_mint_seeds: $(l)Blue Mint Seeds$() are $(l:mint_seeds)mint seeds$() that are used to grow $(l:blue_mint_leaf)blue mint leaves$().
A $(l)Blunder Policy$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that increases the holder's Speed by two stages when one of the holder's moves misses a target due to an accuracy or evasion check.
book.cobblepedia.entries.bold_mint.text: $(l)Bold Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Defense stat and decrease it's Attack stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Bold nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.braised_vivicho: $(l)Braised Vivichoke$() is a $(l:food)food$() item that can be eaten by the player to restore 6 hunger points and 7 saturation.
book.cobblepedia.entries.brave_mint.text: $(l)Brave Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Attack stat and decrease it's Speed stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Brave nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.brew.text: $(l)Brews$() are $(l)potions$(), $(l)sprays$() and $(l)ethers$(), restorative $(l:medicine)medicines$() made from $(l:medicinal_brew)medicinal brew$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.bright_powder.t: $(l)Bright Powder$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that causes the opponent's attacks targeted at the holder to have a 10%% extra reduction in accuracy.
book.cobblepedia.entries.bug_gem.text: $(l)Bug Gem$() is the Bug type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.burn_heal.text: A $(l)Burn Heal$() is a type of $(l:brew#spray)status condition healing medicine$() that cures a Pokémon from a burn when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.bygone_sherd.lo: Can be found buried inside: $(l:crumbling_arch_ruins)Crumbling Arch$(), $(l:decaying_crypt_ruins)Decaying Crypt$(), $(l:fallen_statue_ruins)Fallen Statue$(), $(l:rooted_arch_ruins)Rooted Arch$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.bygone_sherd.te: Bygone variation of the $(l:pottery_sherd)Pokémon-themed pottery sherds$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.bygone_sherd.tr: The Bygone pottery sherd is in reference to the old Cobblemon model of $(pokemon)Kleavor$(), which became a meme within the Cobblemon community due to their design.
book.cobblepedia.entries.calcium.text: A $(l)Calcium$() is a $(l:vitamin)vitamin$() that adds 10 Special Attack EVs to a Pokémon when used if possible (up to a maximum of 100).
book.cobblepedia.entries.calm_mint.text: $(l)Calm Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Special Defense stat and decrease it's Attack stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Calm nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.candy.obtaining: $(l:exp_candy_xs)Exp. Candies XS$(), $(l:exp_candy_s)S$() and $(l:exp_candy_m)M$() can be found in $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chests$() which generate in $(l:ruin_structure)ruins$(). $(l:exp_candy_l)Exp. Candies L$() and $(l:exp_candy_xl)XL$() can only be found in the Creative inventory, or by using commands.
book.cobblepedia.entries.candy.text: $(l)Candies$() are $(l:medicine)medicines$() that can be used on a Pokémon to increase it's experience.
book.cobblepedia.entries.capture_sherd.l: Can be found buried inside: $(l:deserted_house_ruins)Deserted House$(), $(l:deserted_tower_ruins)Deserted Tower$(), $(l:hidden_bunker_ruins)Hidden Bunker$(), $(l:unstable_cave_ruins)Unstable Cave$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.capture_sherd.t: Capture variation of the $(l:pottery_sherd)Pokémon-themed pottery sherds$().
The Capture pottery sherd is in reference to the $(l:poke_ball)Poké Ball$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.carbos.text: A $(l)Carbos$() is a $(l:vitamin)vitamin$() that adds 10 Speed EVs to a Pokémon when used if possible (up to a maximum of 100).
book.cobblepedia.entries.careful_mint.te: $(l)Careful Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Special Defense stat and decrease it's Special Attack stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Careful nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.catching.text: In order to catch Pokémon in a $(l:cobblepedia:poke_balls)Poké Ball$(), the Poké Ball must first be equipped in a player's hand by selecting it in the hotbar. The Poké Ball can then be thrown at a Pokémon for a chance at capture. If a Poké Ball misses a Pokémon, the thrown ball will drop on the ground as an item and can be recovered.
book.cobblepedia.entries.catching.text2: During $(l:cobblepedia:battling)battles$(), selecting the catch button does not automatically start the catching process. Instead, the player must manually equip a $(l:cobblepedia:poke_balls)Poké Ball$(), aim, and throw it themselves.$(br2)Each of the 48 variations of Poké Ball have $(l:cobblepedia:poke_ball_tiers)their own catch rates$(); an assigned value and a possible mechanic that changes the capture chance when thrown at a Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.catching.text3: If the catch fails, the Pokémon will break out of the $(l:cobblepedia:poke_balls)ball$() and the thrown Poké Ball cannot be recovered. If the catch is successful, the Pokémon will be added to the party or be sent to the $(l:cobblepedia:pc)PC$().$(br2)Each variation of Poké Ball will display as an icon in the party menu and PC. These icons are purely aesthetic and have no special features.
book.cobblepedia.entries.cell_battery.te: A $(l)Cell Battery$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that increases the holder's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Electric-type move.
A $(l)Charcoal Stick$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Fire-type moves by 20%%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a combustible fuel that boosts the power of the holder's Fire-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.checkspawn_comm: Used to check the spawning chance of Pokémon for a specified rarity at the command user's current position.
book.cobblepedia.entries.cherish_ball.cr: Unlike all other Poké Balls, the Cherish Ball is not craftable or obtainable in normal gameplay.
book.cobblepedia.entries.cherish_ball.te: A Cherish Ball is an untiered Poké Ball.$(br)Cherish Balls can freely be used for any purpose, such as for event distributions on servers.
book.cobblepedia.entries.cherish_rod.tex: Is a $(l:cherish_ball)cherish ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.chipped_pot.tex: A peculiar teapot that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It may be chipped, but tea poured from it is delicious.
book.cobblepedia.entries.chiseled_black_: $(l)Chiseled Black Tumblestone Bricks$() is one of the $(l:chiseled_tumblestone_bricks)chiseled tumblestone bricks$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.chiseled_polish: $(l)Chiseled Polished Black Tumblestone$() is one of the $(l:chiseled_polished_tumblestone)chiseled polished tumblestone$().
$(l)Chiseled Polished Sky Tumblestone$() is one of the $(l:chiseled_polished_tumblestone)chiseled polished tumblestone$().
$(l)Chiseled Polished Tumblestone$() is one of the $(l:chiseled_polished_tumblestone)chiseled polished tumblestone$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.chiseled_sky_tu: $(l)Chiseled Sky Tumblestone Bricks$() is one of the $(l:chiseled_tumblestone_bricks)chiseled tumblestone bricks$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.chiseled_tumble: $(l)Chiseled Tumblestone Bricks$() is one of the $(l:chiseled_tumblestone_bricks)chiseled tumblestone bricks$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.choice_band.hol: A $(l)Choice Band$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the Attack of the Pokémon holding it by 50%%, but only allows the use of the first move selected in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.choice_band.tex: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This curious headband boosts the holder's Attack stat but only allows the use of a single move.
book.cobblepedia.entries.choice_items.te: These are $(l:held_items)held items$() that boosts an stat and locks the holder into only using a single move.
book.cobblepedia.entries.choice_scarf.ho: A $(l)Choice Scarf$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the Speed of the Pokémon holding it by 50%%, but only allows the use of the first move selected in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.choice_scarf.te: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This curious scarf boosts the holder's Speed stat but only allows the use of a single move.
book.cobblepedia.entries.choice_specs.ho: $(l)Choice Specs$() are a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the Special Attack of the Pokémon holding it by 50%%, but only allows the use of the first move selected in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.choice_specs.te: An item to be held by a Pokémon. These curious glasses boost the holder's Sp. Atk stat but only allow the use of a single move.
book.cobblepedia.entries.citrine_ball.cr: As with the other 6 $(l:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l), it is relatively easy to make, requiring 4 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(/l) and a copper ingot to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.citrine_ball.te: A Citrine Ball is one of the 7 $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l) needed for the A Full Palette advancement.$(br)It is one of the 5 original Poké Balls created for Cobblemon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.citrine_rod.tex: Is a $(l:citrine_ball)citrine ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.claw_fossil.tex: $(l)Claw Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Anorith$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_dripstone_oasis)Dripstone Oasis$(), $(l:prehistoric_frozen_spike)Frozen Spike$(), $(l:prehistoric_mossy_pond)Mossy Pond$(), $(l:prehistoric_preserved_skeleton)Preserved Skeleton$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_impact)Submerged Impact$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_spike)Submerged Spike$(), $(l:prehistoric_underwater_fissure)Underwater Fissure$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.cleanse_tag.tex: A $(l)Cleanse Tag$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() added in version 1.4.1. It currently has no effect.
$(l)Cleaver Feather$() is one of the 6 $(l:feather)EV boosting feathers$() that increases a Pokémon's Special Defense EV when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.clover_sweet.te: A clover-shaped sweet. When a $(pokemon)Milcery$() holds this, it spins around happily.
book.cobblepedia.entries.coarse_mulch.te: A $(l)Coarse Mulch$() is a $(l:mulch)mulch$() that makes the $(l:berry_tree)Berry Tree$() act like it's in a Mountains or Taiga biome for an infinite duration.
book.cobblepedia.entries.cover_fossil.te: $(l)Cover Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Tirtouga$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_frozen_pond)Frozen Pond$(), $(l:prehistoric_hydrothermal_vents)Hydrothermal Vents$(), $(l:prehistoric_preserved_skeleton)Preserved Skeleton$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_impact)Submerged Impact$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_spike)Submerged Spike$(), $(l:prehistoric_underwater_fissure)Underwater Fissure$(), $(l:prehistoric_vibrant_hydrothermal_vents)Vibrant Hydrothermal Vents$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.covert_cloak.te: A $(l)Covert Cloak$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that protects the holder from any additional effects from other Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.cracked_pot.tex: A peculiar teapot that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It may be cracked, but tea poured from it is delicious.
book.cobblepedia.entries.crop.text: $(l)Crops$() are $(l:items)blocks$() that can be planted and harvested.
book.cobblepedia.entries.crumbling_arch_: $(l)Crumbling Arch$() are structures found in the underground in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). This structure contains $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Froglight)Froglights$() which has a 33%% chance to be a verdant, pearlescent or ochre froglight. There is also some secret gravel that can be found at the top of the biggest pillar.
$(l)Cyan Mint Leaf$() is a $(l:mint_leaf)mint leaf$() that can influence a Pokémon's special attack stat. Grows from $(l:cyan_mint_seeds)cyan mint seeds$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.cyan_mint_seeds: $(l)Cyan Mint Seeds$() are $(l:mint_seeds)mint seeds$() that are used to grow $(l:cyan_mint_leaf)cyan mint leaves$().
Damp Rock can be found within $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$() inside of $(l:prehistoric_dripstone_oasis)Dripstone Oases$(), $(l:prehistoric_enhydro_agate)Enhydro Agates$(), $(l:prehistoric_hydrothermal_vents)Hydrothermal Vents$(), $(l:prehistoric_lush_den)Lush Dens$(), $(l:prehistoric_mossy_pond)Mossy Ponds$(), $(l:prehistoric_mud_pit)Mud Pits$(), $(l:prehistoric_rooted_pit)Rooted Pits$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_impact)Submerged Impacts$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_spike)Submerged Spikes$(), $(l:prehistoric_suspicious_mound)Suspicious Mound$(), $(l:prehistoric_underwater_fissure)Underwater Fissures$() and $(l:prehistoric_vibrant_hydrothermal_vents)Vibrant Hydrothermal Vent$() $(l:structures)structures$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.damp_rock.text: A $(l)Damp Rock$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that extends the duration of rain when held, increasing its duration from 5 turns to 8 turns.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dark_gem.text: $(l)Dark Gem$() is the Dark type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dawn_stone.evol: The $(l)Dawn Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.dawn_stone.text: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It sparkles like a glittering eye.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dawn_stone_bloc: Is a $(l:dawn_stone)dawn stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
Commonly found on Peak and Sky biomes and rarely found on Floral, Glacial and Hills biomes.
These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop a $(l:dawn_stone)dawn stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.decaying_crypt_: Digging down leads to a large room with multiple tombstones and spawners. Two versions of this structure can generate; the regular crypt contains 4 tombstone spots, whereas the spider crypt contains 7 tombstone spots. The spider crypt contains a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Poison_Spider)poison spider$() $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Spawner)spawner$() underneath, in which up to 5 $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chests$() or $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chests$() can generate. Both crypts generate $(l:relic_coin_pouch)Relic Coin Pouches$().

$(l)Decaying Crypt$() are structures found in floral biomes in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). On the surface, these resembled crumbling stone brick crypts with a closed off entrance filled with gravel.

There are 5 different types of tombstones that can generate:$(li)$(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Skeleton_Head)Skeleton Head$() tombstone - Weight: 10$(li)Gimmi/Gilded/Barrel tombstone - $(t:50/50 chance of a Gilded Chest or Gimmighoul Chest, then a 20%% chance to be a Barrel)$(o)Weight: 9$().$(li)$(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/SupiciousGravel)Suspicious Gravel$() tombstone, generates with 1 uncommon and 1 rare suspicious gravel - Weight: 9$(li)$(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/TNT)TNT$() trapped tombstone, marked with a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Cracked_Stone_Brick)cracked stone brick$() block on the front of the tomb - Weight: 7$(li)Tombstone with $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Zombie)Zombie$() spawner - Weight: 6
$(l)Deep Sea Scale$() also causes $(pokemon)Clamperl$() to $(l:evolution)evolve$() into $(pokemon)Gorebyss$() when $(pokemon)Clamperl$() is traded holding the item.
When held by $(pokemon)Clamperl$(), $(l)Deep Sea Scale$() doubles its Special Defense.
An item to be held by $(pokemon)Clamperl$(). This scale shines with a faint pink and boosts $(pokemon)Clamperl$()'s Sp. Def stat.
$(l)Deep Sea Tooth$() also causes $(pokemon)Clamperl$() to $(l:evolution)evolve$() into $(pokemon)Gorebyss$() when $(pokemon)Clamperl$() is traded holding the item.
When held by $(pokemon)Clamperl$(), $(l)Deep Sea Tooth$() doubles its Special Attack.
An item to be held by $(pokemon)Clamperl$(). This fang gleams a sharp silver and boosts $(pokemon)Clamperl$()'s Sp. Atk stat.
book.cobblepedia.entries.deserted_house_: $(l)Deserted House$() are structures found in any biome containing $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Sand)Sand$(), not including $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Red_Sand)Red Sand$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Beach)Beaches$(), in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). This structure contains $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Loom)Loom$() which has a 0.01%% chance to become a $(l:relic_coin_sack)Relic Coin Sack$() instead. Chests have a 50/50 to be either a $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chest$() or a $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chest$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.deserted_tower_: $(l)Deserted Tower$() are structures found in any biome containing $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Sand)Sand$(), not including $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Red_Sand)Red Sand$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Beach)Beaches$(), in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). The structure contains 1 $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chest$() and 1 $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chest$() at the bottom, with bookshelves that have a chance to generate a Flame $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Enchanted_Book)Enchanted Book$() or a Curse of Vanishing Enchanted Book.

The Deserted Tower Ruins is a subtle nod to Avatar: The Last Airbender, being based on Wan Shi Tong's Library. The tower also including the Fire Gem, the Earth Gem, the Water Gem, the Flying Gem and the Book of Flame enchanted book is a reference to the four elements in the show, being fire, earth, water and air. The Curse Of Vanishing Enchanted Book that generates within the structure is a reference to the tower's disappearance in the show.
book.cobblepedia.entries.deserted_town_c: $(l)Deserted Town Center$() are structures found in any biome containing $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Sand)Sand$(), not including $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Red_Sand)Red Sand$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Beach)Beaches$(), in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). The structure has 9 different variants each containing 0-3 chests which have a 50% chance to be a $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chest$() or $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chest$(). These structures also generate a variety of random structures around it containing $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.destiny_knot.te: A $(l)Destiny Knot$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that causes the opponent to be infatuated if the holder is infatuated.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dire_hit.text: A $(l)Dire Hit$() is an $(l:x_item)x item$() that temporarily boosts a Pokémon's critical hit ratio.
book.cobblepedia.entries.display_case.te: A $(l)Display Case$() is a decorative block that allows the player to display items similar to an $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Armor_Stand)Armor Stand$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.display_case.us: $(k:use) on an empty Display Case with an item in the right hand will place the item inside of the display case.$(br2)$(k:use) on a filled Display Case with an empty hand will remove the item that is inside and place it inside of the player's inventory.

$(k:use) on a filled Display Case with an item different to the one displayed will replace the displayed item with the one in the player's hand and placing the previously displayed item into the player's inventory.$(br2)$(k:use) on a filled Display Case with the same item to the one displayed will change the orientation of the displayed item to face towards the face of the block that was interacted with.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dive_ball.craft: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Dive Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dive_ball.text: A Dive Ball is a second tier Poké Ball.$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dive_rod.name: Dive Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.dive_rod.text: Is a $(l:dive_ball)dive ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.dome_fossil.tex: $(l)Dome Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Kabuto$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_enhydro_agate)Enhydro Agate$(), $(l:prehistoric_hydrothermal_vents)Hydrothermal Vents$(), $(l:prehistoric_rooted_pit)Rooted Pit$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_den)Sunscorched Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_suspicious_mound)Suspicious Mound$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.dome_sherd.loot: Can be found buried inside: $(l:decaying_crypt_ruins)Decaying Crypt$(), $(l:deserted_tower_ruins)Deserted Tower$(), $(l:mossy_oubliette_ruins)Mossy Oubliette$(), $(l:toppled_pillars_ruins)Toppled Pillars$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.dome_sherd.text: Dome variation of the $(l:pottery_sherd)Pokémon-themed pottery sherds$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.dome_sherd.triv: The Dome pottery sherd is in reference to the $(l:dome_fossil)Dome Fossil$() and $(pokemon)Kabuto$(). It may be seen as an alternate to the $(l:helix_sherd)Helix pottery sherd$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.dragon_fang.hol: A $(l)Dragon Fang$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Dragon-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dragon_fang.tex: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This hard, sharp fang boosts the power of the holder's Dragon-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dragon_gem.text: $(l)Dragon Gem$() is the Dragon type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dragon_scale.ev: A $(l)Dragon Scale$() is an item that is used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Seadra$() into $(pokemon)Kingdra$() when held while using a $(l:cobblepedia:link_cable)link cable$(). This consumes the Dragon Scale.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dragon_scale.te: A very tough and inflexible scale.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dream_ball.craf: Unlike first, second, or third tier Poké Balls, Dream Balls require a diamond and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dream_ball.text: A Dream Ball is a fourth tier Poké Ball.$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dream_rod.name: Dream Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.dream_rod.text: Is a $(l:dream_ball)dream ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.dripstone_moon_: $(l)Moon stone ore$() has a unique generation, mainly generating as a part of dripstone pillars in Dripstone Cave biomes.$(br)They attempt to generate in dripstone blocks 320 times per chunk in groups of 1-2, from levels -64 to 256.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dubious_disc.ev: It's an item used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Porygon2$() into Porygon-Z when held while using a $(l:cobblepedia:link_cable)link cable$(). This consumes the Dubious Disc.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dubious_disc.te: A transparent device overflowing with dubious data. It's loved by a certain Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dusk_ball.craft: Unlike first and second tier Poké Balls, Dusk Balls require a gold ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dusk_ball.text: A Dusk Ball is a third tier Poké Ball. Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dusk_rod.name: Dusk Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.dusk_rod.text: Is a $(l:dusk_ball)dusk ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.dusk_stone.evol: The $(l)Dusk Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.dusk_stone.text: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It holds dark shadows within it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.dusk_stone_bloc: Is a $(l:dusk_stone)dusk stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
Commonly found on Spooky and Taiga biomes and rarely found on Swamp biomes.
These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop a $(l:dusk_stone)dusk stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.eject_button.te: An $(l)Eject Button$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that causes the holder to switch out if hit by a damaging move. This can only happen once per battle and will not activate if there are no Pokémon to switch out to or if the holder is a wild Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.eject_pack.text: An $(l)Eject Pack$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() which causes the holder to automatically switch out whenever any of their stats are lowered.
book.cobblepedia.entries.electirizer.tex: A box packed with a tremendous amount of electric energy. It's loved by a certain Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.electric_gem.te: $(l)Electric Gem$() is the Electric type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.elixir.text: An $(l)Elixir$() is a type of $(l:brew#ether)PP-restoring medicine$() that restores 10 PP to all of a Pokémon's moves when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.energy_root.gen: Energy Roots have a 1/4th chance to replace a $(l:big_root)Big Root$() during generation.
book.cobblepedia.entries.energy_root.obt: Breaking will always yield a single Energy Root. It can be instantly mined with any tool.
book.cobblepedia.entries.energy_root.tex: An $(l)Energy Root$() is a $(l:crop)crop$() that sometimes grows in place of a $(l:big_root)Big Root$(). It can be used to heal a Pokémon at the cost of friendship.
book.cobblepedia.entries.energy_root.usi: An energy root can be used to restore 120 HP to a Pokémon at the cost of 10 Friendship.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ether.text: An $(l)Ether$() is a type of $(l:brew#ether)PP-restoring medicine$() that restores 10 PP to one of a Pokémon's selected moves when used.
Everstone can be found within Suspicious Gravel inside of any of the $(l:fossil_structure)prehistoric structures$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.everstone.text: A $(l)Everstone$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that prevents the holder from evolving.
book.cobblepedia.entries.eviolite.text: An $(l)Eviolite$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that boosts the holders Defense and Special Defense if they are not fully $(l:evolution)evolved$() by 50%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.evolution.parti: Particle Effect that play when a Pokémon evolves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.evolution.text: $(l)Evolution$() is a process in which a Pokémon changes into a different species of Pokémon.$(br2)Whenever a Pokémon is ready to evolve, a message will apear in the chat. To evolve a Pokémon, open the Summary ($(k:cobblemon.summary)), select the Pokémon that can evolve and click in the evolve button on the bottom left corner of the screen.
book.cobblepedia.entries.evolution_stone: $(l)Evolution stones$() are $(l:evolution_items)evolution items$() that can be used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() certain Pokémon. Drops from $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$().

$(l:cobblepedia:evolution_stone_ore)Evolution stone ore$() generation is completely dependent on $(l:https://wiki.cobblemon.com/index.php/Evolution_Stone_Ore#Biome_Tag_Rarity)biome tags$(). All of the various evolution stone ore types have common biome tags in which they generate and rare biome tags in which they generate half as often.

$(l:cobblepedia:evolution_stone_ore)Evolution stone ores$()' $(l)common generation$() comes in two batches. The first batch attempts to generate 8 times per $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Chunk)chunk$() in blobs of 1-2, from levels 64 to 320, being most common around level 192 and becoming less common towards either end of the range. The second batch attempts to generate 8 times per chunk in blobs of 1-2, from levels -64 to 192, being most common around level 64 and becoming less common towards either end of the range.

$(l:cobblepedia:evolution_stone_ore)Evolution stone ores$()' $(l)rare generation$() comes in two batches. The first batch attempts to generate 4 times per $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Chunk)chunk$() in blobs of 1-2, from levels 64 to 320, being most common around level 192 and becoming less common towards either end of the range. The second batch attempts to generate 4 times per chunk in blobs of 1-2, from levels -64 to 192, being most common around level 64 and becoming less common towards either end of the range.

$(l:cobblepedia:evolution_stone_ore)Evolution stone ores$() can be obtained by $(l)mining$() them with a stone or higher $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Tiers)tier$() $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Pickaxe)pickaxe$() $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Enchanting)enchanted$() with $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Silk_Touch)Silk Touch$(). When mined with a pickaxe without the Silk Touch enchantment, evolution stone ores will drop their respective $(l:evolution_stone)evolution stone$(). These $(l:items)blocks$() are not affected by the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Fortune)Fortune enchantment$().
A list, on the official Cobblemon wiki, of all biome tags and rarity $(l:cobblepedia:evolution_stone_ore)Evolution stone ores$() can be generated.
$(l)Evolution stone ores$() are a set of $(l:items)blocks$() that can be $(l:cobblepedia:evolution_stone_mining)mined$(/l) to yield a single $(l:evolution_stone)evolution stone$().
List, on the official Cobblemon wiki, of Pokémon that can be $(l:evolution)evolved$() with $(l)evolution stones$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_l.tex: A candy that is packed with energy. If consumed, it grants a Pokémon a large number of Exp. Points.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_l.usi: A $(l)Exp. Candy L$() is an item that, when used on a Pokémon, it increases that Pokémon's exp by 10,000.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_m.tex: A candy that is packed with energy. If consumed, it grants a Pokémon a moderate number of Exp. Points.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_m.usi: A $(l)Exp. Candy M$() is an item that, when used on a Pokémon, it increases that Pokémon's exp by 3,000.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_s.tex: A candy that is packed with energy. If consumed, it grants a Pokémon a small number of Exp. Points.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_s.usi: A $(l)Exp. Candy S$() is an item that, when used on a Pokémon, it increases that Pokémon's exp by 800.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_xl.te: A candy that is packed with energy. If consumed, it grants a Pokémon a very large number of Exp. Points.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_xl.us: A $(l)Exp. Candy XL$() is an item that, when used on a Pokémon, it increases that Pokémon's exp by 30,000.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_xs.te: A candy that is packed with energy. If consumed, it grants a Pokémon a very small number of Exp. Points.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_candy_xs.us: A $(l)Exp. Candy XS$() is an item that, when used on a Pokémon, it increases that Pokémon's exp by 100.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_share.holdi: An item to be held by a Pokémon. The holder gets a share of a battle's Exp. Points without battling.
book.cobblepedia.entries.exp_share.text: This special device allows the Pokémon on your team to share in Exp. Points gained.
book.cobblepedia.entries.expert_belt.tex: An $(l)Expert Belt$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that boosts the damage of the holder's super effective moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fairy_feather.l: Fairy Feathers can be obtained via $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Supicious_Blocks)Suspicious Blocks$() found within $(l:prehistoric_lush_den)Prehistoric Lush Dens$(), $(l:prehistoric_oak_tree)Prehistoric Oak Trees$() and $(l:prehistoric_spruce_tree)Prehistoric Spruce Tree$() $(l:structures)structures$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.fairy_feather.t: A $(l)Fairy Feather$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that, when held, boosts the power of Fairy-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fairy_gem.text: $(l)Fairy Gem$() is the Fairy type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fallen_statue_r: $(l)Fallen Statue$() are structures found in any biome containing $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Sand)Sand$(), not including $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Red_Sand)Red Sand$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Beach)Beaches$(), in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). The structure resembles a toppled statue reminiscent of the Pokémon $(pokemon)Golett$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.fast_ball.craft: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Fast Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fast_ball.text: A Fast Ball is one of the 7 apricorn Poké Balls needed for the $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_balls#advancement)Kurt would be Proud advancement$(/l).$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fast_rod.name: Fast Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.fast_rod.text: Is a $(l:fast_ball)fast ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.feather.name: Feathers
book.cobblepedia.entries.feather.text: $(l)Feathers$() are $(l:items)items$() which can be used to increase one of a Pokémon's EVs by 1 point.$(br2)As of Cobblemon update 1.5.2, Feathers are only accessible through the Creative inventory or with commands.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fighting_gem.te: $(l)Fighting Gem$() is the Fighting type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fine_remedy.tex: A $(l)Fine Remedy$() is a type of $(l:medicine)medicine$() that restores 100 HP whilst reducing Friendship when used on a Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fire_gem.text: $(l)Fire Gem$() is the Fire type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fire_stone.evol: The $(l)Fire Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.fire_stone.text: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It has a fiery orange heart.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fire_stone_bloc: Is a $(l:fire_stone)fire stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
Commonly found on Desert, Thermal and Volcanic biomes and rarely found on Sandy biomes.
These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop a $(l:fire_stone)fire stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.flame_orb.text: A $(l)Flame Orb$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that burns its holder at the end of the turn.
book.cobblepedia.entries.float_stone.tex: A $(l)Float Stone$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that causes the holder's weight to be halved, to a minimum of 0.1kg.
book.cobblepedia.entries.flower_sweet.te: A flower-shaped sweet. When a $(pokemon)Milcery$() holds this, it spins around happily.
book.cobblepedia.entries.flying_gem.text: $(l)Flying Gem$() is the Flying type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.focus_band.hold: A $(l)Focus Band$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that has a 10%% chance of preventing the Pokémon holding it from fainting with 1 HP remaining.
book.cobblepedia.entries.focus_band.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder is hit with a move that should knock it out, it may prevent the Pokémon from fainting.
book.cobblepedia.entries.focus_sash.text: A $(l)Focus Sash$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that prevents the Pokémon holding it from fainting in one hit with 1 HP remaining. The item only activates once per battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.food.text: $(l)Food$() are items that can be consumed by the player.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fossil.name: Fossil
book.cobblepedia.entries.fossil.obtainin: Fossils can be obtained by using a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/brush)brush$() on $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/suspicious_sand)suspicious sand$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/suspicious_gravel)suspicious gravel$() in $(l:fossil_structure)fossil structures$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.fossil.text: $(l)Fossils$() are items which can be used to obtain fossil Pokémon when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.fossil_analyzer: A $(l)Fossil Analyzer$() is a utility block which is used as part of the $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$() multi-block. It is used to hold the fossils that are to be revived in the machine. Fossils can also be inserted via a hopper.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fossil_structur: $(l)Fossil Dig Sites$() are $(l:archaeology)archaeological$() $(l:structures)structures$() that generate throughout the world. These structures usually blend into its environment and contain $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$(). Within these blocks, $(l:fossil)Fossils$() are contained, with one of the suspicious blocks containing at least one guaranteed fossil based on the generated structure.
book.cobblepedia.entries.fossilized_bird: $(l)Fossilized Bird$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Dracozolt$() or $(pokemon)Arctozolt$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_birch_tree)Birch Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_mossy_pond)Mossy Pond$(), $(l:prehistoric_oak_tree)Oak Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_powdered_deposit)Powdered Deposit$(), $(l:prehistoric_spruce_tree)Spruce Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_suspicious_mound)Suspicious Mound$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.fossilized_dino: $(l)Fossilized Dino$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $$(pokemon)Arctovish$() or $(pokemon)Arctozolt$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_frozen_pond)Frozen Pond$(), $(l:prehistoric_frozen_spike)Frozen Spike$(), $(l:prehistoric_oak_tree)Oak Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_powdered_deposit)Powdered Deposit$(), $(l:prehistoric_preserved_skeleton)Preserved Skeleton$(), $(l:prehistoric_sandy_den)Sandy Den$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.fossilized_drak: $(l)Fossilized Drake$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Dracovish$() or $(pokemon)Dracozolt$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_birch_tree)Birch Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_lush_den)Lush Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_mud_pit)Mud Pit$(), $(l:prehistoric_rooted_pit)Rooted Pit$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_den)Sunscorched Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_remains)Sunscorched Remains$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.fossilized_fish: $(l)Fossilized Fish$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Arctovish$() or $(pokemon)Dracovish$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_dripstone_oasis)Dripstone Oasis$(), $(l:prehistoric_enhydro_agate)Enhydro Agate$(), $(l:prehistoric_frozen_spike)Frozen Spike$(), $(l:prehistoric_hydrothermal_vents)Hydrothermal Vents$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_impact)Submerged Impact$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_spike)Submerged Spike$(), $(l:prehistoric_underwater_fissure)Underwater Fissure$(), $(l:prehistoric_vibrant_hydrothermal_vents)Vibrant Hydrothermal Vents$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.friend_ball.cra: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Friend Balls requires an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.friend_ball.tex: A Friend Ball is one of the 7 apricorn Poké Balls needed for the $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_balls#advancement)Kurt would be Proud advancement$(/l).$(br)Pokémon caught in a Friend Ball will start with 150 Friendship.
book.cobblepedia.entries.friend_rod.name: Friend Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.friend_rod.text: Is a $(l:friend_ball)friend ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.friendship_comm: Used to check a Pokémon's friendship level in a specified slot in the command user's party.
book.cobblepedia.entries.full_heal.text: A $(l)Full Heal$() is a type of $(l:brew#spray)status condition healing medicine$() that cures a Pokémon of all status conditions when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.full_restore.te: A $(l)Full Restore$() is a type of $(l:brew#potion)HP-restoring medicine$() that fully restores HP and fully recovers any status conditions when used on a Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.galarica_cuff.t: A cuff made from woven-together Galarica Twigs. Giving it to a $(pokemon)Galarian Slowpoke$() makes the Pokémon very happy.
book.cobblepedia.entries.galarica_wreath: A wreath made from woven-together Galarica Twigs. Placing it on the head of a $(pokemon)Galarian Slowpoke$() makes the Pokémon very happy.
$(l)Genius Feather$() is one of the 6 $(l:feather)EV boosting feathers$() that increases a Pokémon's Special Attack EV when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.gentle_mint.tex: $(l)Gentle Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Special Defense stat and decrease it's Defense stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Gentle nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ghost_gem.text: $(l)Ghost Gem$() is the Ghost type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.gilded_chest.ge: Gilded Chests can be found naturally generated within $(l:gimmighoul_towers)Gimmi Towers$(), with a chance to replace a $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chest$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.gilded_chest.te: A $(l)Gilded Chest$() is the $(l:red_apricorn)red apricorn$() $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn#colors)color$() storage block that allows the player to store items similar to a vanilla $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Chest)Chest$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.gimmighoul.name: Gimmighoul
book.cobblepedia.entries.gimmighoul.text: Gimmighouls can be found on $(l:ruin_structure)ruins$() as a $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chest$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.gimmighoul_ches: Gimmighoul Chests can be found naturally generated within $(l:gimmighoul_towers)Gimmi Towers$(), with a chance to be replaced by a $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chest$().
Gimmighoul Chests are not obtainable by $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Silk_Touch)Silk Touch$(). They are available only through the Creative inventory or $(l:commands)commands$().

A $(l)Gimmighoul Chest$() is a unique block that will spawn a $(pokemon)Gimmighoul$() in its place when the block is either opened or broken. Its appearance is identical to a $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chest$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.gimmighoul_towe: Each Gimmighoul Tower has 3 segments, with the first 2 segments having a chance to be a platform. 60%% of the time, the chests will be a $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chest$(). 40%% of the time, the chest will be a $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chest$(). The top segment is inverted, meaning 60%% of the time the chest will be a $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chest$() and 40%% of the time the chest will be a $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chest$().

$(l)Gimmighoul Towers$(), or $(l)Gimmi Towers$() are structures found in a variety of biomes in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). These structures have a variant for each biome they appear in, with each variant also having a trapped variant which has a 30%% chance to generate instead of a regular version.

The trapped variants include:$(li)Temperate -> $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Silverfish)Silverfish$() infested tower$(li)Lush -> $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Bee)Bee$() infested tower$(li)Sunscorched -> A $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/TNT)TNT$() trap will be set at the top of the tower, with a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Pressure_Plate)Pressure Plate$() in the center that will set the trap off$(li)Frozen -> An $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Evoker)Evoker$() spawns at the top of the tower$(li)Swamp -> $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Witch)Witches$() spawn at the top of the tower
Desert Gimmighoul Towers are slightly different, as each segment has a roughly 30%% chance to spawn a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Husk)Husk$() within.
