Gimmighoul Towers also have in-built compatibility with waystones mods and will generate a waystone at the top of the tower.
book.cobblepedia.entries.giveallpokemon_: Used to give one of every available Pokémon to the command user.$(br)The Pokémon will be sent to the command user's $(l:cobblepedia:pc)PC$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.givepokemon_com: Used to give a specified Pokémon to the command user.
$(c)/givepokemon <pokemon> [attributes]$()$(p)Alias: $(c)/pokegive$()$(p)Example: $(c:/givepokemon abra shiny ability=synchronize)$(c)/givepokemon abra shiny ability=synchronize$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.givepokemonothe: Used to give a specified Pokémon to a specified player.
$(c)/givepokemonother <target> <pokemon> [attributes]$()$(p)Example: $(c:/givepokemonother @a abra shiny ability=synchronize)$(c)/givepokemonother @a abra shiny ability=synchronize$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.grass_gem.text: $(l)Grass Gem$() is the Grass type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.great_ball.craf: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Great Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.great_ball.text: A Great Ball is a second tier Poké Ball.$(br)It functions as a direct upgrade to the Poké Ball, as it has a higher static catch rate.
book.cobblepedia.entries.great_rod.name: Great Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.great_rod.text: Is a $(l:great_ball)great ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.green_gilded_ch: A $(l)Green Gilded Chest$() is the $(l:green_apricorn)green apricorn$() $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn#colors)color$() variation of a $(l:gilded_chest)gilded chest$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.green_mint_leaf: $(l)Green Mint Leaf$() is a $(l:mint_leaf)mint leaf$() that can influence a Pokémon's speed stat. Grows from $(l:green_mint_seeds)green mint seeds$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.green_mint_seed: $(l)Green Mint Seeds$() are $(l:mint_seeds)mint seeds$() that are used to grow $(l:green_mint_leaf)green mint leaves$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.ground_gem.text: $(l)Ground Gem$() is the Ground type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.growth_mulch.te: A $(l)Growth Mulch$() is a $(l:mulch)mulch$() that increases the growth rate of the $(l:berry_tree)Berry Tree$() that it is used on for 3 harvests.
book.cobblepedia.entries.guard_spec.text: A $(l)Guard Spec$() is an $(l:x_item)x item$() that temporarily prevents stat reduction during battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.hard_stone.hold: When held, Hard Stone raises the power of Rock-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.hard_stone.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a durable stone that boosts the power of the holder's Rock-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.hasty_mint.text: $(l)Hasty Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Speed stat and decrease it's Defense stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Hasty nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.heal_ball.craft: Unlike the $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l), Heal Balls require a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.heal_ball.text: A Heal Ball is a first tier Poké Ball.
book.cobblepedia.entries.heal_powder.tex: $(l:)Heal Powder$() is a type of status condition healing $(l:medicine)medicine$() that cures a Pokémon of all status conditions whilst reducing friendship when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.heal_rod.name: Heal Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.heal_rod.text: Is a $(l:heal_ball)heal ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.healing_machine: A $(l)healing machine$() is a utility block that allows the player to heal the Pokémon in their party.$(br)The healing machine will start with zero charge when placed in non-Creative game modes. The healing machine will charge up over time, and can be used indefinitely once fully charged.
book.cobblepedia.entries.healpokemon_com: Used to heal a specified player's party.
$(l)Health Feather$() is one of the 6 $(l:feather)EV boosting feathers$() that increases a Pokémon's HP EV when used.
Heat Rock can be found within $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() inside of $(l:prehistoric_eroded_pillar)Prehistoric Eroded Pillars$(), $(l:prehistoric_oak_tree)Prehistoric Oak Trees$(), $(l:prehistoric_birch_tree)Prehistoric Birch Trees$(), $(l:prehistoric_sandy_den)Prehistoric Sandy Dens$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_den)Prehistoric Sunscorched Dens$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_remains)Prehistoric Sunscorched Remains$() and $(l:prehistoric_suspicious_mound)Prehistoric Suspicious Mound$() $(l:structures)structures$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.heat_rock.text: A $(l)Heat Rock$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that extends the duration of harsh sunlight when held, increasing its duration from 5 turns to 8 turns.
book.cobblepedia.entries.heavy_ball.craf: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Heavy Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.heavy_ball.text: A Heavy Ball is one of the 7 apricorn Poké Balls needed for the $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_balls#advancement)Kurt would be Proud advancement$(/l).$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.heavy_duty_boot: $(l)Heavy-Duty Boots$() are a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that makes the holder immune to entry hazards (Stealth Rock, Spikes, Sticky Web etc.).
An item to be held by a Pokémon. These boots protect the holder from the effects of traps and the like set on the battlefield.
book.cobblepedia.entries.heavy_rod.name: Heavy Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.heavy_rod.text: Is a $(l:heavy_ball)heavy ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.held_item_comma: Used to change the $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() for a Pokémon in a specified slot in a specified player's party.
book.cobblepedia.entries.helix_fossil.te: $(l)Helix Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Omanyte$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_dripstone_oasis)Dripstone Oasis$(), $(l:prehistoric_enhydro_agate)Enhydro Agate$(), $(l:prehistoric_eroded_pillar)Eroded Pillar$(), $(l:prehistoric_preserved_skeleton)Preserved Skeleton$(), $(l:prehistoric_sandy_den)Sandy Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_vibrant_hydrothermal_vents)Vibrant Hydrothermal Vents$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.helix_sherd.loo: Can be found buried inside: $(l:deserted_town_center_ruins)Deserted Town Center$(), $(l:fallen_statue_ruins)Fallen Statue$(), $(l:mossy_oubliette_ruins)Mossy Oubliette$(), $(l:toppled_pillars_ruins)Toppled Pillars$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.helix_sherd.tex: Helix variation of the $(l:pottery_sherd)Pokémon-themed pottery sherds$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.helix_sherd.tri: The Helix pottery sherd is in reference to the $(l:helix_fossil)Helix Fossil$() and $(pokemon)Omanyte$(). The usage of it as a pot pattern may be in reference to historical depictions of gods on clay pots in real life and "$(l:https://antifandom.com/twitchplayswiki/wiki/Lord_Helix)Lord Helix$()", an Omanyte from popular live-stream "$(l:https://www.twitch.tv/twitchplayspokemon)Twitch Plays Pokémon$()", which became an object of worship throughout the livestreams.
By utilizing a bag of $(l:surprise_mulch)Surprise Mulch$() at Stage 0, a Stage 9 $(l:revival_herb)Revival Herb$() $(l:crop)crop$() can be $(l:berry_mutating)mutated$() into one of the 4 following crops; $(l:mental_herb)Mental Herb$(), $(l:power_herb)Power Herb$(), $(l:white_herb)White Herb$(), or $(l:mirror_herb)Mirror Herb$().$(br)Breaking a Herb crop drops 1 Herb.
book.cobblepedia.entries.herb.text: A $(l)Herb$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$(). It will be consumed after use.
book.cobblepedia.entries.hidden_bunker_r: $(l)Hidden Bunker$() are structures found in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Snowy_Taiga)Snowy Taiga$() biomes in the $(l)Overworld$(). The structure contains a hidden trapdoor with a ladder to a bunker, which can be revealed by either breaking the snow or melting it unintentionally by using the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Smoker)Smoker$().

There are 8 locations for random blocks to generate on the trapdoor shelving:$(li)Group of 3 $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Light_Gray_Candle)light gray candles$() - 10%% chance$(li)Group of 4 light gray candles - 10%% chance$(li)$(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Bookshelf)Bookshelf$() - 20%% chance$(li)$(l:relic_coin_pouch)Relic Coin Pouch$() - 20%% chance$(li)$(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chest$() - 10%% chance$(li)$(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chest$() - 10%% chance
book.cobblepedia.entries.holding_evoluti: Those are $(l:evolution_items)evolution items$() that can be used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() certain Pokémon when a condition is met while it $(l:held_items)holds$() that item. This consumes the Item.
book.cobblepedia.entries.hp_up.text: An $(l)HP Up$() is a $(l:vitamin)vitamin$() that adds 10 HP EVs to a Pokémon when used if possible (up to a maximum of 100).
book.cobblepedia.entries.humid_mulch.tex: A $(l)Humid Mulch$() is a $(l:mulch)mulch$() that makes the $(l:berry_tree)Berry Tree$() act like it's in a Jungle or Swamp biome for an infinite duration.
book.cobblepedia.entries.hyper_potion.te: A $(l)Hyper Potion$() is a type of $(l:brew#potion)HP-restoring medicine$() that restores 150 HP when used on a Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ice_gem.text: $(l)Ice Gem$() is the Ice type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ice_heal.text: An $(l)Ice Heal$() is a type of $(l:brew#spray)status condition healing medicine$() that thaws a Pokémon from frozen when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ice_stone.evolv: The $(l)Ice Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.ice_stone.text: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It has a snowflake pattern in it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ice_stone_block: Is a $(l:ice_stone)ice stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ice_stone_ore.g: Commonly found on Glacial, Snowy and Tundra biomes and rarely found on Freezing biomes.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ice_stone_ore.t: These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop an $(l:ice_stone)ice stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.icy_rock.loot.t: Icy Rock can be found within $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() inside of $(l:prehistoric_frozen_pond)Prehistoric Frozen Ponds$(), $(l:prehistoric_frozen_spike)Prehistoric Frozen Spikes$(), $(l:prehistoric_powdered_deposit)Prehistoric Powdered Deposits$(), $(l:prehistoric_preserved_skeleton)Prehistoric Preserved Skeletons$(), $(l:prehistoric_spruce_tree)Prehistoric Spruce Trees$() and $(l:prehistoric_submerged_spike)Prehistoric Submerged Spike$() $(l:structures)structures$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.icy_rock.text: An $(l)Icy Rock$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that extends the duration of hail or snow when held, increasing its duration from 5 turns to 8 turns.
book.cobblepedia.entries.impish_mint.tex: $(l)Impish Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Defense stat and decrease it's Special Attack stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Impish nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.iron.text: An $(l)Iron$() is a $(l:vitamin)vitamin$() that adds 10 Defense EVs to a Pokémon when used if possible (up to a maximum of 100).$(br2)$(o)Not to be confused with Minecraft $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Iron)Iron$(/l).$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.iron_ball.text: An $(l)Iron Ball$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that reduces the holder's Speed by 50%%.$(br)It also causes the holder to be grounded and thus susceptible to Ground-type moves, Arena Trap, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Sticky Web and terrain, even if it is a Flying-type or is levitating.
book.cobblepedia.entries.jaw_fossil.text: $(l)Jaw Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Tyrunt$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_eroded_pillar)Eroded Pillar$(), $(l:prehistoric_lush_den)Lush Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_mud_pit)Mud Pit$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_den)Sunscorched Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_remains)Sunscorched Remains$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.jolly_mint.text: $(l)Jolly Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Speed stat and decrease it's Special Attack stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Jolly nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.kings_rock.evol: It is also used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Poliwhirl$() and $(pokemon)Slowpoke$() to evolve into $(pokemon)Politoed$() and $(pokemon)Slowking$() respectively, when held while using a $(l:cobblepedia:link_cable)link cable$(). This consumes the King's Rock.
book.cobblepedia.entries.kings_rock.hold: A $(l)King's Rock$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that grants the holder's damaging attacks a 10%% chance of causing the target to flinch.
book.cobblepedia.entries.kings_rock.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It may cause the target to flinch whenever the holder successfully inflicts damage on them with an attack.
book.cobblepedia.entries.lax_mint.text: $(l)Lax Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Defense stat and decrease it's Special Defense stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Lax nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.leaf_stone.evol: The $(l)Leaf Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.leaf_stone.text: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It has an unmistakable leaf pattern.
book.cobblepedia.entries.leaf_stone_bloc: Is a $(l:leaf_stone)leaf stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
Commonly found on Forest, Jungle and Lush biomes and rarely found on Swamp and Tropical biomes.
These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop a $(l:leaf_stone)leaf stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.leek_and_potato: $(l)Leek and potato stew$() is not a fast-eating $(l:food)food$() item like $(l:medicinal_leek)medicinal leek$() or $(l:roasted_leek)roasted leek$(), but it does restore 8 hunger and 0.6 saturation when eaten. The bowl that contains the stew is returned to the player's inventory afterwards.
book.cobblepedia.entries.leftovers.holdi: $(l)Leftovers$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that heals 1/16 of the holder's maximum HP (rounded down, but not less than 1) at the end of each turn.
book.cobblepedia.entries.leftovers.obtai: Leftovers have a 2.5%% chance to appear after eating an apple.
book.cobblepedia.entries.leftovers.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It gradually restores the holder's HP over time.
book.cobblepedia.entries.level_ball.craf: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Level Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.level_ball.text: A Level Ball is one of the 7 apricorn Poké Balls needed for the $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_balls#advancement)Kurt would be Proud advancement$(/l).$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.level_rod.name: Level Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.level_rod.text: Is a $(l:level_ball)level ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.levelup_command: Used to increase the level of a Pokémon in a specified slot in a specified player's party by 1.
book.cobblepedia.entries.life_orb.text: A $(l)Life Orb$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's moves by 30%%, but causes the holder to take damage equal to 10%% of its maximum HP after using a damaging move.
book.cobblepedia.entries.light_ball.text: A $()Light Ball$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that doubles both the Attack and Special Attack of the Pikachu holding it. If held by any other Pokémon, this item has no effect.
book.cobblepedia.entries.light_clay.hold: A $(l)Light Clay$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that extends the duration of the moves Reflect, Aurora Veil and Light Screen from five turns to eight.
book.cobblepedia.entries.light_clay.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder uses protective moves like Light Screen or Reflect, their effects will last longer than usual.
book.cobblepedia.entries.link_cable.evol: $(pokemon)Kadabra$(), $(pokemon)Machoke$(), $(pokemon)Graveler$(), $(pokemon)Alolan Graveler$(), $(pokemon)Haunter$(), $(pokemon)Boldore$(), $(pokemon)Gurdurr$(), $(pokemon)Phantump$(), and $(pokemon)Pumpkaboo$() can be $(l:evolution)evolved$() by using a $(l)link cable$() on them.

$(pokemon)Poliwhirl$(), $(pokemon)Slowpoke$(), $(pokemon)Onix$(), $(pokemon)Scyther$(), $(pokemon)Seadra$(), $(pokemon)Porygon$(), $(pokemon)Porygon2$(), $(pokemon)Clamperl$(), $(pokemon)Feebas$(), $(pokemon)Rhydon$(), $(pokemon)Electabuzz$(), $(pokemon)Magmar$(), $(pokemon)Dusclops$(), $(pokemon)Spritzee$(), and $(pokemon)Swirlix$() can be $(l:evolution)evolved$() by using a $(l)link cable$() while the Pokémon is $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)holding$() a specific item.
book.cobblepedia.entries.link_cable.loot: $(l)Link cables$() will be available as chest loot in future updates.
book.cobblepedia.entries.link_cable.text: A $(l)link cable$() is an evolutionary item that can be used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() Pokémon that evolve via trading.
book.cobblepedia.entries.loaded_dice.tex: A $(l)Loaded Dice$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that causes multi-hit moves used by the holder to always hit at least four times if possible.
book.cobblepedia.entries.loamy_mulch.tex: A $(l)Loamy Mulch$() is a $(l:mulch)mulch$() that makes the $(l:berry_tree)Berry Tree$() act like it's in a Plains biome for an infinite duration.
book.cobblepedia.entries.lonely_mint.tex: $(l)Lonely Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Attack stat and decrease it's Defense stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Lonely nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.love_ball.craft: Unlike first and second tier Poké Balls, Love Balls require a gold ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.love_ball.text: A Love Ball is one of the 7 apricorn Poké Balls needed for the $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_balls#advancement)Kurt would be Proud advancement$(/l).$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.love_rod.name: Love Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.love_rod.text: Is a $(l:love_ball)love ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.love_sweet.text: A heart-shaped sweet. When a $(pokemon)Milcery$() holds this, it spins around happily.
book.cobblepedia.entries.lucky_egg.holdi: A $(l)Lucky Egg$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the amount of experience a Pokémon gains after battle by 50%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.lucky_egg.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's an egg filled with happiness that earns the holder extra Exp. Points.
book.cobblepedia.entries.lure_ball.craft: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Lure Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.lure_ball.text: A Lure Ball is one of the 7 apricorn Poké Balls needed for the $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_balls#advancement)Kurt would be Proud advancement$(/l).$(br)Increases the catch rate of Pokémon that were caught on a $(l:lure_rod)fishing rod$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.lure_rod.name: Lure Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.lure_rod.text: Is a $(l:lure_ball)lure ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.luxury_ball.cra: Unlike first and second tier Poké Balls, Luxury Balls require a gold ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.luxury_ball.tex: A Luxury Ball is a third tier Poké Ball.
book.cobblepedia.entries.luxury_rod.name: Luxury Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.luxury_rod.text: Is a $(l:luxury_ball)luxury ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.magmarizer.text: A box packed with a tremendous amount of magma energy. It's loved by a certain Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.magnet.holding: A $(l)Magnet$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Electric-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.magnet.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a powerful magnet that boosts the power of the holder's Electric-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.malicious_armor: $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Nether_Fortress)Nether fortress$() chests may contain Malicious Armor in stacks of 1.

A $(l)Malicious Armor$() is an $(l:evolution_items)evolution item$() that is used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Charcadet$() into $(pokemon)Ceruledge$(). Using it consumes the Malicious Armor. It is a counterpart to $(l:auspicious_armor)Auspicious Armor$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.master_ball.cra: Unlike the other tiers of Poké Balls, Master Balls require a nether star and a specific pattern of shulker shells and netherite ingots to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.master_ball.tex: A Master Ball is the highest tier of Poké Ball.$(br)It functions as the final upgrade to the Poké Ball, as it has a higher static catch rate.
book.cobblepedia.entries.master_rod.name: Master Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.master_rod.text: Is a $(l:master_ball)master ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.masterpiece_tea: Masterpiece Teacups can be found within $(l:ruin_structure)Ruin structures$() as Suspicious Block loot in $(l:crumbling_arch_ruins)Crumbling Arch Ruins$(), $(l:deserted_house_ruins)Deserted House Ruins$(), $(l:hidden_bunker_ruins)Hidden Bunker Ruins$() or $(l:toppled_pillars_ruins)Toppled Pillars Ruins$().

A $(l)Masterpiece Teacup$() is one of the $(l:evolution_items)evolution items$() that is used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() Artisan Form $(pokemon)Poltchageist$() into Masterpiece Form $(pokemon)Sinistcha$() when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.max_elixir.text: A $(l)Max Elixir$() is a type of $(l:brew#ether)PP-restoring medicine$() that fully restores all PP to all of a Pokémon's moves when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.max_ether.text: A $(l)Max Ether$() is a type of $(l:brew#ether)PP-restoring medicine$() that fully restores all PP to one of a Pokémon's selected moves when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.max_potion.text: A $(l)Max Potion$() is a type of $(l:brew#potion)HP-restoring medicine$() that fully restores HP when used on a Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.max_revive.text: A $(l)Max Revive$() is a type of $(l:medicine)medicine$() that revives and fully heals a fainted Pokémon when used.
A $(l)Medicinal Brew$() is an $(l:items)item$() that is used to craft various $(l:vitamin)vitamins$() or $(l:brew)brews$().
Putting a medicinal leek in a composter has a 65%% chance of raising the compost level by 1.
$(l:food)Eating$() a medicinal leek restores 1 hunger and 0.2 saturation.$(br)A player can consume medicinal leeks about twice as fast as many other food items in the game, much like dried kelp.

When planted on top of water or any waterlogged block, medicinal leeks will go through 4 growth stages. Their growth rate is not affected by light or other environmental factors.$(br)When bone meal is used on a medicinal leek, its growth stage will increase by one.
Medicinal leeks can be found spawning in clusters of 4~ spread out near the shores of non-saltwater water biomes. This includes rivers, swamps, and any modded biome tagged as Freshwater.

Breaking a fully grown medicinal leek drops 2-3 medicinal leeks, while a non-fully grown one will only ever drop 1. Using a tool enchanted with fortune will cause a fully grown leek to drop more, up to a maximum of 5 leeks.$(br)Medicinal leeks can be insta-mined with any tool or no tool.
A $(l)medicinal leek$() is a $(l:crop)crop$() that can found growing on freshwater and is used to make medicinal brews.
book.cobblepedia.entries.medicine.text: $(l)Medicine$() are $(l:consumables)consumables$() with restorative or stat boosting properties that can be used on a Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mental_herb.tex: A $(l)Mental Herb$() is a $(l:herb)herb$() that cures the holder of infatuation and other mental effects. It will be consumed after use.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mental_herb.usa: A Mental Herb cures the holder of $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Status_condition#Infatuation)Infatuation$(), $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Status_condition#Taunt)Taunt$(), $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Status_condition#Encore)Encore$(), $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Status_condition#Torment)Torment$(), $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Status_condition#Heal_Block)Heal Block$() or $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Status_condition#Disable)Disable$(). If the holder is affected by any of these mental effects, the Mental Herb will activate and the mental effect will be cured.
book.cobblepedia.entries.metal_coat.hold: A $(l)Metal Coat$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Steel-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.metal_coat.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a special metallic coating that boosts the power of the holder's Steel-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.metronome.text: A $(l)Metronome$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of moves used consecutively by the Pokémon holding it by 20%% for each previous, consecutive turn the move has been used successfully, up to a maximum increase of 100%% (or 6 or more consecutive uses).
book.cobblepedia.entries.mild_mint.text: $(l)Mild Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Special Attack stat and decrease it's Defense stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Mild nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mint.text: A $(l)mint$() is a $(l:consumables)consumable$() item crafted from $(l:mint_leaf)mint leaves$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() on its stats, making it act as if the Pokémon had a certain nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mint.usage.text: Mints can be used to change the effect of a Pokémon's nature on its stats to that of the nature corresponding to the mint used. For instance, using a Naive Mint on a Pikachu with a Naughty nature will change Pikachu's stats to be that of a Naive nature. The Pokémon's actual Nature, however, remains unchanged.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mint_leaf.farmi: Mint leaves are obtained by harvesting the final stage of a $(l:mint_seeds)mint crop$(), which produces 1-3 of the respective mint leaf.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mint_leaf.text: A $(l)mint leaf$() is an item used to craft $(l:mint)mints$() and is obtained by harvesting mint crops grown from $(l:mint_seeds)mint seeds$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.mint_seeds.text: $(l)Mint Seeds$() are $(l:crop)crops$() used to grow their respective $(l:mint_leaf)mint leaves$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.miracle_seed.ho: A $(l)Miracle Seed$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Grass-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.miracle_seed.te: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a seed imbued with life-force that boosts the power of the holder's Grass-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mirror_herb.tex: A $(l)Mirror Herb$() is a $(l:herb)herb$() that copies all of the opponent's increased stats. It will be consumed after use.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mirror_herb.usa: A Mirror Herb copies all of the opponent's increased stats. For example, if the opponent uses $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Swords_Dance)Swords Dance$(), the Mirror Herb will activate and raise the holder's attack stage to +2 as well.$(br)A Mirror Herb does not allow the holder to learn an egg move when in the party with a compatible Pokémon outside of battle currently (as of version 1.4.0).
book.cobblepedia.entries.modest_mint.tex: $(l)Modest Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Special Attack stat and decrease it's Attack stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Modest nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.monitor.text: A $(l)Data Monitor$() is a utility block which is used as part of the $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$() multi-block. It functions as a visualization of the embryo development progression, displaying a bar that fills up as the embryo develops. It can activate a Redstone Comparator depending on the current level of progress.
book.cobblepedia.entries.moon_ball.craft: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Moon Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.moon_ball.text: A Moon Ball is one of the 7 apricorn Poké Balls needed for the $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn_balls#advancement)Kurt would be Proud advancement$(/l).$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.moon_rod.name: Moon Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.moon_rod.text: Is a $(l:moon_ball)moon ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.moon_stone.evol: The $(l)Moon Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.moon_stone.text: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It is dark like the night sky.
book.cobblepedia.entries.moon_stone_bloc: Is a $(l:moon_stone)moon stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
Commonly found on Taiga, Dripstone, Magical and Spooky biomes.
These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop a $(l:moon_stone)moon stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.mossy_oubliette: $(l)Mossy Oubliette$() are structures found in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Swamp)Swamp$() biomes in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). The structure contains cracked stone brick, hinting that the player should mine behind it. The structure generates $(l:relic_coin_pouch)Relic Coin Pouches$().

Inside are 3 traps, minus any mobs that spawn within:$(li)A $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Tripwire)Tripwire$() which activates a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Dispenser)Dispenser$() which fires a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Splash_Potion)Splash Potion$() of Poison at the player$(li)A floor with a pot in the center which falls if the player breaks the pot in the center, which will cause the player to fall onto $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Pointed_Dripstone)Pointed Dripstone$()$(li)There will be a specific block which $(t:Sometimes this may fail due to normal gunpowder also being in the activated dispenser instead of just TNT)$(o)will activate$() $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/TNT)TNT$() that falls from the ceiling.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mulch.text: $(l)Mulch$() is an $(l:items)item$() that is used to give $(l:berry_tree)berry trees$() a certain boost.$(br)A $(l:mulch_base)Mulch Base$() is an item used to craft a variety of different Mulch.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mulch.usage.tex: Mulch can be used on a $(l:berry_tree)Berry Tree$() one at a time. It can be removed by interacting with the tree with a shovel, or destroying the tree.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mulch_base.text: A $(l)Mulch$() is an $(l:items)item$() that is used to craft a variety of different $(l:mulch)Mulches$(). It is the fundamental component in creating Mulch used in applying modifiers to $(l:berry_tree)berry trees$() and various other $(l:crop)crops$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.muscle_band.hol: A $(l)Muscle Band$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's physical moves by 10%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.muscle_band.tex: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This headband exudes strength, slightly boosting the power of the holder's physical moves.
$(l)Muscle Feather$() is one of the 6 $(l:feather)EV boosting feathers$() that increases a Pokémon's Attack EV when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mutated_berry.t: A $(l)mutated berry$() is a type of $(l:berry)berry$() which can be obtained by crossbreeding different $(l:berry_tree)berry trees$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.mystic_water.ho: $(l)Mystic Water$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Water-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.mystic_water.te: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This teardrop-shaped gem boosts the power of the holder's Water-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.naive_mint.text: $(l)Naive Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Speed stat and decrease it's Special Defense stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Naive nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.natural_berry.t: A $(l)natural berry$() is a type of $(l:berry)berry$() which can be obtained from $(l:berry_tree)berry trees$() generated in the world.
book.cobblepedia.entries.naughty_mint.te: $(l)Naughty Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Attack stat and decrease it's Special Defense stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Naughty nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.nest_ball.craft: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Nest Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.nest_ball.text: A Nest Ball is a second tier Poké Ball.$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.nest_rod.name: Nest Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.nest_rod.text: Is a $(l:nest_ball)nest ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.net_ball.crafti: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Net Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.net_ball.text: A Net Ball is a second tier Poké Ball.$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.net_rod.name: Net Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.net_rod.text: Is a $(l:net_ball)net ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
$(l)Never-Melt Ice$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Ice-type moves by 20%%.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a heat-repelling piece of ice that boosts the power of the holder's Ice- type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.normal_gem.text: $(l)Normal Gem$() is the Normal type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.nostalgic_sherd: Can be found buried inside: $(l:crumbling_arch_ruins)Crumbling Arch$(), $(l:deserted_town_center_ruins)Deserted Town Center$(), $(l:rooted_arch_ruins)Rooted Arch$()
Nostalgic variation of the $(l:pottery_sherd)Pokémon-themed pottery sherds$().
The Nostalgic pottery sherd is in reference to the classic $(pokemon)Rhydon$()-like menu sprite in Generation 1/2, used for a select group of Pokémon in that generation.
The $()Nurse$() is a villager profession found in $(l:village_pokecenter)Village Poké Centers$() that specializes in buying and selling healing items, as well as selling glass bottles; adding a crucial bit of renewability for Cobblemon’s potion system.
book.cobblepedia.entries.old_amber_fossi: $(l)Old Amber$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Aerodactyl$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_frozen_pond)Frozen Pond$(), $(l:prehistoric_lush_den)Lush Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_oak_tree)Oak Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_spruce_tree)Spruce Tree$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.openstarterscre: Displays the starter Pokémon select interface for a specified player.
book.cobblepedia.entries.oval_stone.evol: The $(l)Oval Stone$() causes $(pokemon)Happiny$() to $(l:evolution)evolve$() into $(pokemon)Chansey$() when held, and $(pokemon)Happiny$() is leveled up during the day.
When is leveled up during the day.
book.cobblepedia.entries.oval_stone.text: A peculiar stone that can make a certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It is round and smooth.
book.cobblepedia.entries.paralyze_heal.t: A $(l)Paralyze Heal$() is a type of $(l:brew#spray)status condition healing medicine$() that cures a Pokémon from paralysis when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.park_ball.craft: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Park Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.park_ball.text: A Park Ball is a second tier Poké Ball.$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.park_ball.trivi: Its design and functionality was inspired by the Park Ball that appeared in episode 161 of the Pokémon anime series, rather than the unobtainable Park Ball that was introduced in the Generation IV game series.
book.cobblepedia.entries.park_rod.name: Park Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.park_rod.text: Is a $(l:park_ball)park ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.pasture.text: A $(l)Pasture Block$() is a utility block that allows the player to deposit Pokémon from their $(l:pc)PC$() into the surrounding area.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pasture.usage.t: The main purpose of the pasture block is to allow players to let out their Pokémon into a set area, being able to be interacted as if they were wild or thrown out of their $(l:poke_ball)ball$().
Pressing use on a pasture block opens the GUI of the player's PC.$(br)A pasture block can hold up to 16 Pokémon.$(br)Pasture blocks can be waterlogged, allowing players to let out Pokémon underwater.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pc.text: A $(l)PC$() is a utility block that allows the player to access the Pokémon storage system.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pc_command.text: Used to access the command user's $(l:cobblepedia:pc)PC$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.peat_block.text: A block of muddy material that can be used as fuel for burning when it is dried. It's loved by a certain Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.peat_mulch.text: A $(l)Peat Mulch$() is a $(l:mulch)mulch$() that makes the $(l:berry_tree)Berry Tree$() act like it's in a Forest biome for an infinite duration.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pep_up_flower.o: Breaking the final stage of a $(l:revival_herb)Revival Herb$() drops 1-2 Pep-Up Flowers.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pep_up_flower.t: $(l)Pep-Up Flower$() is a $(l:crop)crop$() that can be used to craft various $(l:medicine)medicines$(). They are obtained randomly via $(l:revival_herb)Revival Herbs$(). It can also be placed in a Flower Pot.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pink_gilded_che: A $(l)Pink Gilded Chest$() is the $(l:pink_apricorn)pink apricorn$() $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn#colors)color$() variation of a $(l:gilded_chest)gilded chest$().
$(l)Pink Mint Leaf$() is a $(l:mint_leaf)mint leaf$() that can influence a Pokémon's special defense stat. Grows from $(l:pink_mint_seeds)pink mint seeds$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.pink_mint_seeds: $(l)Pink Mint Seeds$() are $(l:mint_seeds)mint seeds$() that are used to grow $(l:pink_mint_leaf)pink mint leaves$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.plume_fossil.te: $(l)Plume Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Archen$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_birch_tree)Birch Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_mossy_pond)Mossy Pond$(), $(l:prehistoric_rooted_pit)Rooted Pit$(), $(l:prehistoric_spruce_tree)Spruce Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_suspicious_mound)Suspicious Mound$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.poison_barb.hol: A $(l)Poison Barb$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Poison-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.poison_barb.tex: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This small poisonous barb boosts the power of the holder's Poison-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.poison_gem.text: $(l)Poison Gem$() is the Poison type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.poke_ball.craft: As with the other 6 $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l), it is relatively easy to make, requiring 4 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(/l) and a copper ingot to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.poke_ball.text: A Poké Ball is one of the 7 $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l) needed for the A Full Palette advancement.$(br)While Poké Ball can be a general term to refer to a Poké Ball of any kind, Poké Ball can also refer to this ball type specifically.
book.cobblepedia.entries.poke_ball_intro: As of Cobblemon version 1.4.1, all Poké Balls must be crafted as there is no other way to obtain them. New villager professions will potentially sell Poké Balls and related items in future updates.

The $(l:cherish_ball)Cherish Ball$() and $(l:ancient_origin_ball)Ancient Origin Ball$() are unobtainable in survival gameplay and can only be obtained through Creative Mode or commands. They can freely be used for any purpose, such as for event distributions on servers.
$(l)Poké Balls$() are one of the most important tools in Cobblemon. Other Pokémon cannot be obtained aside from the chosen initial starter without them.
book.cobblepedia.entries.poke_ball_tiers: Poké balls crafted with exotic materials
Poké balls have tiers based on the tier of their main crafting material.
book.cobblepedia.entries.poke_rod.text: Is a $(l:poke_ball)poke ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokebox_command: Used to send a Pokémon in a specified slot from a specified player's party to the specified box of their $(l:cobblepedia:pc)PC$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokedex.lectern: Poké Dexes can be placed on lecterns.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokedex.name: Pokédex
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokemon_drops.t: Pokémon may drop items after being defeated. The items that they drop depend on the species.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokemon_drops.w: A list, on the official Cobblemon wiki, of all items that can be drop by Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokemon_spawnin: Pokémon can spawn in almost every biome. Pokémon have their own spawn conditions depending on the species.
A list, on the official Cobblemon wiki, of all biome tags Pokémon can spawn on.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokemonedit_com: Used to edit a Pokémon in a specified slot in the command user's party.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokemoneditothe: Used to edit a Pokémon in a specified slot of a specified player's party.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokerod.baits.t: $(l:berry)Berries$() can be used as baits, giving different fishing effects. Holding berries in your off-hand while casting the line will attatch all berries to the Poké Rod and consume one when it hits water (indicated by light blue particles) while giving it's respective fishing bait effects.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokerod.name: Poké Rods
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokerod.text: $(l)Poké Rods$()! You'll need a $(l:pokerod_smithing_template)Poké Rod smithing template$(), a fishing rod, and some type of $(l:poke_balls)Poké Ball$(). Each Poké Ball makes a differently themed rod (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.pokerod_smithin: Used to upgrade a fishing rod with a $(l:poke_balls)Poké Ball$() to create a $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.polished_black_: $(l)Polished Black Tumblestone$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestones)polished tumblestones$().
$(l)Polished Black Tumblestone Slab$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestone_slabs)polished tumblestone slabs$().
$(l)Polished Black Tumblestone Stairs$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestones_stairs)polished tumblestone stairs$().
$(l)Polished Black Tumblestone Wall$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestone_walls)polished tumblestone walls$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.polished_sky_tu: $(l)Polished Sky Tumblestone$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestones)polished tumblestones$().
$(l)Polished Sky Tumblestone Slab$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestone_slabs)polished tumblestone slabs$().
$(l)Polished Sky Tumblestone Stairs$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestones_stairs)polished tumblestone stairs$().
$(l)Polished Sky Tumblestone Wall$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestone_walls)polished tumblestone walls$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.polished_tumble: $(l)Polished Tumblestone$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestones)polished tumblestones$().
$(l)Polished Tumblestone Slab$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestone_slabs)polished tumblestone slabs$().
$(l)Polished Tumblestone Stairs$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestones_stairs)polished tumblestone stairs$().
$(l)Polished Tumblestone Wall$() is one of the $(l:polished_tumblestone_walls)polished tumblestone walls$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.potion.text: A $(l)Potion$() is a type of $(l:brew#potion)HP-restoring medicine$() that restores 60 HP when used on a Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pottery_sherd.l: Pottery Sherds can be obtained by using a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/brush)brush$() on $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/suspicious_sand)suspicious sand$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/suspicious_gravel)suspicious gravel$() in $(l:ruin_structure)ruin structures$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.pottery_sherd.t: $(l)Pottery Sherds$() are $(l:items)items$() that are used to craft $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Decorated_Pot)decorated pots$() with unique designs.$(br)Currently, Cobblemon adds 6 new pottery sherds.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_anklet.te: A $(l)Power Anklet$() is a $(l:power_item)power item$() that gives extra Speed $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() when the $(l:held_items)holder$() participates in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_anklet.us: A Power Anklet gives 8 Speed $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() in addition the base EV yield of the Pokémon defeated, while halving the Speed stat of the holder.$(br2)A Power Band will guarantee the passing down of the holder's Speed $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Individual_values)IVs$() to the child when bred. If both parents hold a Power Anklet, one parent will be chosen randomly to pass down its Speed IV. (not available as of Cobblemon 1.5.2)
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_band.text: A $(l)Power Band$() is a $(l:power_item)power item$() that gives extra Special Defense $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() when the $(l:held_items)holder$() participates in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_band.usag: A Power Band gives 8 Special Defense $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() in addition the base EV yield of the Pokémon defeated, while halving the Special Defense stat of the holder.$(br2)A Power Band will guarantee the passing down of the holder's Special Defense $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Individual_values)IVs$() to the child when bred. If both parents hold a Power Band, one parent will be chosen randomly to pass down its Special Defense IV. (not available as of Cobblemon 1.5.2)
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_belt.text: A $(l)Power Belt$() is a $(l:power_item)power item$() that gives extra Defense $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() when the $(l:held_items)holder$() participates in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_belt.usag: A Power Belt gives 8 Defense $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() in addition the base EV yield of the Pokémon defeated, while halving the Defense stat of the holder.$(br2)A Power Belt will guarantee the passing down of the holder's Defense $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Individual_values)IVs$() to the child when bred. If both parents hold a Power Belt, one parent will be chosen randomly to pass down its Defense IV. (not available as of Cobblemon 1.5.2)
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_bracer.te: A $(l)Power Bracer$() is a $(l:power_item)power item$() that gives extra Attack $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() when the $(l:held_items)holder$() participates in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_bracer.us: A Power Bracer gives 8 Attack $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() in addition the base EV yield of the Pokémon defeated, while halving the Attack stat of the holder.$(br2)A Power Bracer will guarantee the passing down of the holder's Attack $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Individual_values)IVs$() to the child when bred. If both parents hold a Power Bracer, one parent will be chosen randomly to pass down its Attack IV. (not available as of Cobblemon 1.5.2)
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_herb.text: A $(l)Power Herb$() is a $(l:herb)herb$() that allows the holder to execute a move that charges in one turn. It will be consumed after use.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_herb.usag: A Power Herb allows the holder to execute a move that charges in one turn. For example, if the holder uses $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Dig)Dig$(), the Power Herb activates and allows the holder to attack on that same turn. If the holder uses $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Solar_Beam)Solar Beam$() during $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Harsh_sunlight)Harsh sunlight$(), the Power Herb does not activate.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_item.text: $(l)Power items$() are $(l:held_items)held items$() that award a Pokémon additional specific $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() whenever the Pokémon would normally earn EVs in battle, but halves Speed of the Pokémon while it holds the item.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_lens.text: A $(l)Power Lens$() is a $(l:power_item)power item$() that gives extra Special Attack $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() when the $(l:held_items)holder$() participates in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_lens.usag: A Power Lens gives 8 Special Attack $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() in addition the base EV yield of the Pokémon defeated, while halving the Special Attack stat of the holder.$(br2)A Power Lens will guarantee the passing down of the holder's Special Attack $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Individual_values)IVs$() to the child when bred. If both parents hold a Power Lens, one parent will be chosen randomly to pass down its Special Attack IV. (not available as of Cobblemon 1.5.2)
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_weight.te: A $(l)Power Weight$() is a $(l:power_item)power item$() that gives extra HP $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() when the $(l:held_items)holder$() participates in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.power_weight.us: A Power Weight gives 8 HP $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Effort_values)EVs$() in addition the base EV yield of the Pokémon defeated, while halving the HP stat of the holder.$(br2)A Power Weight will guarantee the passing down of the holder's HP $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Individual_values)IVs$() to the child when bred. If both parents hold a Power Weight, one parent will be chosen randomly to pass down its HP IV. (not available as of Cobblemon 1.5.2)
book.cobblepedia.entries.pp_max.text: A $(l)PP Max$() is a $(l:vitamin)vitamin$() that increases the maximum PP of a selected move by 160%% of the move's base PP.
book.cobblepedia.entries.pp_up.text: A $(l)PP Up$() is a $(l:vitamin)vitamin$() that increases the maximum PP of a selected move by 20%% of the move's base PP.
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_bir: $(l)Birch Trees$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome that naturally grows $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Birch)Birch Trees$(). It resembles a large, fallen birch tree with no leaves. Digging underneath the remains will lead to Stripped Birch Log built to resemble the tree roots and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_dri: $(l)Dripstone Oases$() are structures found underground in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Dripstone_Caves)Dripstone Caves$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_enh: $(l)Enhydro Agates$() are structures found underground in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Lush_Caves)Lush Caves$(). The structure is guaranteed to generate Deepslate Water Stone Ore inside of it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_ero: $(l)Eroded Pillar$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome that naturally includes $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Red_Sand)Red Sand$(). It resembles an askew pillar of natural materials ranging in size. Within the pillar includes $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_fro: $(l)Frozen Pond$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome in which $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ice)Ice$() can form, other than $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ocean)Oceans$(). It resembles a small frozen pond of water. Underneath the water includes $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().

$(l)Frozen Spike$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome in which $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ice)Ice$() can form, other than $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ocean)Oceans$(). It resembles a small frozen spike. Within the spike are deposits of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_hyd: $(l)Hydrothermal Vents$() are structures found on the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ocean)Ocean$() floor in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). It resembles a small set of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Basalt)Basalt$() pillars with $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Magma_Block)Magma blocks$() scattered around them. Underneath and around the ground near the pillars, $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() can spawn.
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_lus: $(l)Lush Dens$() are structures found in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Jungle)Jungles$() on the surface of the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). It resembles a small cave outcrop covered by $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Jungle_Leaves)Jungle Leaves$(). Inside the outcrop, $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() can spawn.
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_mos: $(l)Mossy Ponds$() are structures found in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Lush_Caves)Lush Caves$() between y=10 and y=-37 of the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). The structure is guaranteed to generate $(l:deepslate_water_stone_ore)Deepslate Water Stone Ore$() inside of it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_mud: $(l)Mud Pits$() are structures found in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Jungle)Jungles$() in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_oak: $(l)Oak Trees$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome that naturally grows $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Oak)Oak Trees$(). It resembles a large, fallen oak tree with no leaves. Digging underneath the remains will lead to Stripped Oak Log built to resemble the tree roots and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_pow: $(l)Powdered Deposits$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome that has a natural abundance of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Snow)Snow$(). It resembles an outcrop of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Powdered_Snow)Powdered Snow$(). Digging underneath the powdered snow will lead to $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_pre: $(l)Preserved Skeletons$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ocean)Ocean$() with naturally generating $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ice)Ice$(). It resembles a boulder of ice with $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Bone_Block)Bone Blocks$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$() and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() inside.
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_roo: $(l)Rooted Pits$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Swamp)Swamp$(). It resembles small pile of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Mangrove_Roots)Mangrove Roots$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Clay)Clay$() and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Mud)Mud$(), along with $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_san: $(l)Sandy Dens$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome with naturally generating $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Sand)Sand$() other than $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Beach)Beaches$(). It resembles an outcrop of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Sandstone)Sandstone$() and sand with a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Pointed_Dripstone)Pointed Dripstone$() hanging inside of the outcrop. Surrounding it is $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_spr: $(l)Spruce Trees$() are structures found on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome that naturally grows $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Spruce)Spruce Trees$(). It resembles a large, fallen spruce tree with no leaves. Digging underneath the remains will lead to Stripped Spruce Log built to resemble the tree roots and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_sub: $(l)Submerged Impacts$() are structures found in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ocean)Oceans$() on the ocean floor. It resembles an outcrop of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Gravel)Gravel$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Stone)Stone$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Stone_Slab)Stone Slabs$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Granite)Granite$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Dripstone_Block)Dripstone$() and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Magma_Block)Magma Blocks$() with $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Pointed_Dripstone)Pointed Dripstone$() inside of the outcrop. Surrounding it is $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().

$(l)Submerged Spikes$() are structures found in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ocean)Oceans$() with naturally generating $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ice)Ice$() on the ocean floor. It resembles a spike of ice on top of a pile of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Sand)Sand$(). Surrounding it is $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_sun: $(l)Sunscorched Dens$() are structures found in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome with naturally generating $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Red_Sand)Red Sand$(). It resembles an outcrop of red sand, $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Terracotta)Terracotta$() and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Gravel)Gravel$(), with some $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().

$(l)Sunscorched Remains$() are structures found in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any biome with naturally generating $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Red_Sand)Red Sand$(). It resembles an outcrop of red sand, $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Smooth_Basalt)Smooth Basalt$() and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Gravel)Gravel$(), with some $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_sus: $(l)Suspicious Mounds$() are structures found in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Plains)Plains$() biomes. It resembles an mound of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Grass_Block)Grass Blocks$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Dirt)Dirt$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Tuff)Tuff$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Mossy_Cobblestone)Mossy Cobblestone$() and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Water)Water$(), with some $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_und: $(l)Underwater Fissures$() are structures found in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Deep_Ocean)Deep Oceans$(). It resembles a fissure in the ocean floor with $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Magma_Block)Magma Block$() and some $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.prehistoric_vib: $(l)Vibrant Hydrothermal Vents$() are structures found in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$() in any lukewarm to warm $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Ocean)Ocean$(). It resembles a small set of $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Basalt)Basalt$() pillars with $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Magma_Block)Magma blocks$() scattered around them. Underneath and around the ground near the pillars, $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$() can spawn.
book.cobblepedia.entries.premier_ball.cr: As with the other 6 $(l:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l), it is relatively easy to make, requiring 4 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(/l) and a copper ingot to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.premier_ball.te: A Premier Ball is one of the 7 $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l) needed for the A Full Palette advancement.
book.cobblepedia.entries.premier_ball.tr: Conversely to its original appearance in the Pokémon games, where Premier Balls were only obtainable by purchasing 10 other Poké Balls at shops, Premier Balls are easily craftable in Cobblemon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.premier_rod.tex: Is a $(l:premier_ball)premier ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.prism_scale.evo: The $(l)Prism Scale$() causes $(pokemon)Feebas$() to $(l:evolution)evolve$() into $(pokemon)Milotic$() when traded holding the item.
book.cobblepedia.entries.prism_scale.tex: A mysterious scale that causes a certain Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It shines in rainbow colors.
book.cobblepedia.entries.protective_pads: $(l)Protective Pads$() are a $(l:held_items)held item$() that protects the holder from the effects of moves that make contact with the target.
book.cobblepedia.entries.protector.text: A protective item of some sort. It is extremely stiff and heavy. It's loved by a certain Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.protein.text: A $(l)Protein$() is a $(l:vitamin)vitamin$() that adds 10 Attack EVs to a Pokémon when used if possible (up to a maximum of 100).
book.cobblepedia.entries.psychic_gem.tex: $(l)Psychic Gem$() is the Psychic type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
A $(l)Punching Glove$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that increases the power of the holder's punching moves by 10%% and prevents contact with targets via these moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.quick_ball.craf: Unlike first and second tier Poké Balls, Quick Balls require a gold ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.quick_ball.text: A Quick Ball is a third tier Poké Ball.$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.quick_claw.hold: A $(l)Quick Claw$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that grants the holder a 20%% chance of going first if the moves all Pokémon use are within the same Speed priority level.
book.cobblepedia.entries.quick_claw.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. A light, sharp claw that lets the bearer move first occasionally.
book.cobblepedia.entries.quick_rod.name: Quick Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.quick_rod.text: Is a $(l:quick_ball)quick ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.quiet_mint.text: $(l)Quiet Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Special Attack stat and decrease it's Speed stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Quiet nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.rare_candy.text: A candy that is packed with energy. If consumed, it raises a Pokémon's level by one.
book.cobblepedia.entries.rare_candy.usin: A $(l)Rare candy$() is an item that, when used on a Pokémon, it increases that Pokémon's level by 1.
book.cobblepedia.entries.rash_mint.text: $(l)Rash Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Special Attack stat and decrease it's Special Defense stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Rash nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.razor_claw.evol: It is also an $(l:cobblepedia:evolution_items)evolution item$() used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Sneasel$() into $(pokemon)Weavile$() if $(pokemon)Sneasel$() holds the Razor Claw at night. This consumes the Razor Claw.
book.cobblepedia.entries.razor_claw.hold: A $(l)Razor Claw$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that raises the holder's critical hit ratio by one stage. (1/8 instead of 1/16, if no other modifiers are in effect).
book.cobblepedia.entries.razor_claw.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sharply hooked claw boosts the critical-hit ratio of the holder's moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.razor_fang.evol: It is also used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Gligar$() into $(pokemon)Gliscor$() if $(pokemon)Gligar$() holds the Razor Fang at night. This consumes the Razor Fang.
book.cobblepedia.entries.razor_fang.hold: A $(l)Razor Fang$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that grants the holder's damaging attacks a 10%% chance of causing the target to flinch.
book.cobblepedia.entries.razor_fang.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sharply hooked fang may cause the target to flinch whenever the holder successfully inflicts damage on them with an attack.
book.cobblepedia.entries.reaper_cloth.ev: A $(l)Reaper Cloth$() is an item that is used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Dusclops$() into $(pokemon)Dusknoir$() when held while using a $(l:cobblepedia:link_cable)link cable$(). This consumes the Reaper Cloth.
book.cobblepedia.entries.reaper_cloth.te: A cloth imbued with horrifyingly strong spiritual energy. It's loved by a certain Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.red_card.text: A $(l)Red Card$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that causes the attacker to switch out if the holder is hit by another Pokémon's damaging move. The item only activates once per battle and will not activate if the attacker is a wild Pokémon or its Trainer has no Pokémon to switch in.
book.cobblepedia.entries.red_mint_leaf.t: $(l)Red Mint Leaf$() is a $(l:mint_leaf)mint leaf$() that can influence a Pokémon's attack stat. Grows from $(l:red_mint_seeds)red mint seeds$().
$(l)Red Mint Seeds$() are $(l:mint_leaf)mint seeds$() that are used to grow $(l:red_mint_leaf)red mint leaves$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.relaxed_mint.te: $(l)Relaxed Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Defense stat and decrease it's Speed stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Relaxed nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.relic_coin.loot: Relic Coins can be found randomly in $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chests$() found within $(l:ruin_structure)ruin structures$(). They can also be obtained via breaking a naturally generated $(l:relic_coin_pouch)Relic Coin Pouch$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.relic_coin.text: A $(l)Relic Coin$() is a type of item that is used to increase $(pokemon)Gimmighoul$()'s "Coin Stash" meter by 1, up to 999.
book.cobblepedia.entries.relic_coin_pouc: Relic Coin Pouches can generate naturally within $(l:ruin_structure)ruin structures$(), but will instead drop a random amount of $(l:relic_coin)Relic Coins$().
Relic Coin Pouches can be found randomly in $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chests$() found within $(l:ruin_structure)ruin structures$().
A $(l)Relic Coin Pouch$() is a type of item that is used to increase $(pokemon)Gimmighoul$()'s "Coin Stash" meter by 9, up to 999. It can also be placed as a decorative block.
book.cobblepedia.entries.relic_coin_sack: A $(l)Relic Coin Sack$() is a type of item that is used to increase $(pokemon)Gimmighoul$()'s "Coin Stash" meter by 81, up to 999. It can also be placed as a decorative block.
book.cobblepedia.entries.remedy.text: A $(l)Remedy$() is a type of $(l:medicine)medicine$() that restores 60 HP whilst reducing Friendship when used on a Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.repeat_ball.cra: Unlike first and second tier Poké Balls, Repeat Balls require a gold ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.repeat_ball.tex: A Repeat Ball is a third tier Poké Ball that increasing the catch reate of Pokémon that are already registered as caught in a player's $(l:pokedex)Pokédex$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.repeat_rod.name: Repeat Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.repeat_rod.text: Is a $(l:repeat_ball)repeat ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
$(l)Resist Feather$() is one of the 6 $(l:feather)EV boosting feathers$() that increases a Pokémon's Defense EV when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.restoration_tan: A $(l)Restoration Tank$() is a utility block which is used as part of the $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$() multi-block. It functions as the chamber in which the fossil embryo grows within and can contain liquid organic material. Organic material can also be inserted via a hopper and can activate a Redstone Comparator depending on the amount of organic material inserted into the tank.
book.cobblepedia.entries.resurrection_ma: A $(l)Resurrection Machine$() is a multi-block structure that allows the player to revive $(l:fossil)Fossils$() into Pokémon. The structure consists of 3 different blocks; the $(l:restoration_tank)Restoration Tank$(), $(l:fossil_analyzer)Fossil Analyzer$() and the $(l:monitor)Data Monitor$(), which when placed correctly will create an electrical sound indicating that the construction was successful.

To begin restoring a fossil, the Restoration Tank must be filled with organic materials of a total value of 64, alongside the appropriate fossil or fossils. Once all conditions are met, the Resurrection Machine will begin reviving the fossil in which an embryo of the corresponding fossil will grow in the Restoration Tank.

After 12 minutes, the embryo will be fully grown, in which players can then either break the tank to release the embryo as a wild Pokémon or can right click with a $(l:poke_balls)Poké Ball$() in their main hand to place the Pokémon in the chosen ball and add it to their party. Players other than the original player who began the revival process will not be capable of claiming the fossil Pokémon for a time.
book.cobblepedia.entries.revival_herb.co: Putting a Revival Herb in a Composter has a 65%% chance of raising the compost level by 1.
book.cobblepedia.entries.revival_herb.fa: Revival Herbs can be placed on farmland. After being placed, it goes through eight stages of growth.$(br)When bone meal is used on a Revival Herb crop, its growth stage will increase by one.
book.cobblepedia.entries.revival_herb.ge: Revival Herbs can be found growing naturally in Lush Caves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.revival_herb.mu: By utilizing a bag of Surprise Mulch at Stage 0, a Stage 9 Revival Herb crop can be mutated into one of the 4 following crops; Mental Herb, Power Herb, White Herb, and Mirror Herb.
book.cobblepedia.entries.revival_herb.ob: Stage 1-7 Revival Herbs will drop a single Revival Herb.$(br)Stage 8 Revival Herbs will drop 2-3 Revival Herb.$(br)Stage 9 Revival herbs will drop 3-4 Revival Herbs and 1-2 $(l:pep_up_flower)Pep-Up Flowers$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.revival_herb.te: A $(l)Revival Herb$() is a $(l:crop)crop$() that can be found growing naturally in Lush Caves. It can be used to craft certain $(l:items)items$() or used directly to fully revive a fainted Pokémon whilst reducing Friendship.
book.cobblepedia.entries.revive.text: A $(l)Revive$() is a type of $(l:medicine)medicine$() that revives a fainted Pokémon to 50%% of their max HP when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ribbon_sweet.te: A ribbon-shaped sweet. When a $(pokemon)Milcery$() holds this, it spins around happily.
book.cobblepedia.entries.rich_mulch.text: A $(l)Rich Mulch$() is a $(l:mulch)mulch$() that increases the yield of the harvest of the $(l:berry_tree)Berry Tree$() that it is used on for 3 harvests.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ring_target.tex: The $(l)Ring Target$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$(). It removes the holder's type immunities to moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.roasted_leek.te: A $(l)roasted leek$() is a fast-to-eat $(l:food)food$() item just like the $(l:medicinal_leek)medicinal leek$(), but it restores 3 hunger and 0.3 saturation.
book.cobblepedia.entries.rock_gem.text: $(l)Rock Gem$() is the Rock type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.rocky_helmet.ho: $(l)Rocky Helmet$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that causes a Pokémon that uses a move that makes contact with the holder to take 1/6 of its maximum HP in damage.
book.cobblepedia.entries.rocky_helmet.te: An item to be held by a Pokémon. If another Pokémon makes direct contact with the holder, that Pokémon will be damaged.
book.cobblepedia.entries.room_service.te: $(l)Room Service$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that causes the holders speed to drop by one stage if the effects of the move Trick Room are active whilst the holder is active. Once the effect takes place, this item is consumed for the remainder of the battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.root_fossil.tex: $(l)Root Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Lileep$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_hydrothermal_vents)Hydrothermal Vents$(), $(l:prehistoric_rooted_pit)Rooted Pit$(), $(l:prehistoric_sandy_den)Sandy Den$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_impact)Submerged Impact$(), $(l:prehistoric_submerged_spike)Submerged Spike$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_remains)Sunscorched Remains$(), $(l:prehistoric_underwater_fissure)Underwater Fissure$(), $(l:prehistoric_vibrant_hydrothermal_vents)Vibrant Hydrothermal Vents$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.rooted_arch_rui: $(l)Rooted Arch$() are structures found in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Lush_Cave)Lush Cave$() biomes on the surface in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.roseate_ball.cr: As with the other 6 $(l:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l), it is relatively easy to make, requiring 4 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(/l) and a copper ingot to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.roseate_ball.te: A Roseate Ball is one of the 7 $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l) needed for the A Full Palette advancement.$(br)It is one of the 5 original Poké Balls created for Cobblemon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.roseate_rod.tex: Is a $(l:roseate_ball)roseate ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
$(l)Ruins$() are a set of $(l:archaeology)archaeological$() $(l:structures)structures$() that generate throughout the world. These structures usually resemble man-made, abandoned structures and contain $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chests$() and $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chests$(). Alongside these chests, $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$() can generate. Some structures also has a "trapped" variant which contains a hazard or a variant of an existing hazard.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sachet.evolving: A $(l)Sachet$() is an item that is used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Spritzee$() into $(pokemon)Aromatisse$() when held while using a $(l:cobblepedia:link_cable)link cable$(). This consumes the Sachet.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sachet.text: A sachet filled with fragrant perfumes that are just slightly overwhelming. Yet it's loved by a certain Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.safari_ball.cra: Unlike the $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l), Safari Balls requires a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.safari_ball.tex: A Safari Ball is a first tier Poké Ball.$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.safari_rod.name: Safari Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.safari_rod.text: Is a $(l:safari_ball)safari ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
$(l)Safety Goggles$() are a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that grants the holder with immunity to powder and spore moves, as well as protection from damage caused by hail and sandstorm.
An item to be held by a Pokémon. These goggles protect the holder from both sandstorm damage and the effects of powders and spores.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sail_fossil.tex: $(l)Sail Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Amaura$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_eroded_pillar)Eroded Pillar$(), $(l:prehistoric_frozen_pond)Frozen Pond$(), $(l:prehistoric_frozen_spike)Frozen Spike$(), $(l:prehistoric_powdered_deposit)Powdered Deposit$(), $(l:prehistoric_spruce_tree)Spruce Tree$().
