book.cobblepedia.entries.sandy_mulch.tex: A $(l)Sandy Mulch$() is a $(l:mulch)mulch$() that makes the $(l:berry_tree)Berry Tree$() act like it's in a Arid biome for an infinite duration.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sassy_mint.text: $(l)Sassy Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Special Defense stat and decrease it's Speed stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Sassy nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.scope_lens.text: A $(l)Scope Lens$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that increases the holder's critical hit ratio by one stage.
book.cobblepedia.entries.serious_mint.te: $(l)Serious Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to not increase or decrease it's stats, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Serious nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sharp_beak.hold: When held, Sharp Beak raises the power of Flying-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sharp_beak.text: n item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a long, sharp beak that boosts the power of the holder's Flying-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.shed_shell.text: A $(l)Shed Shell$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that allows the holder to switch out even if it is under the effects of a trapping move or ability. This does not, however, allow the player to flee or Teleport under these effects.
book.cobblepedia.entries.shell_bell.text: $(l)Shell Bell$() are a $(l:held_items)held item$() that restores HP equal to 1/8 of the damage dealt by the holder's damaging moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.shiny_pokemon.s: Shiny sparkles play when a shiny Pokémon is sent out of its ball or when you look at them directly!
book.cobblepedia.entries.shiny_pokemon.t: $(l)Shiny Pokémon$() are special Pokémon that have a different color to normal Pokémon.$(p)Pokémon have a 1 in 8192 chance to $(l:cobblepedia:pokemon_spawning)spawn$() as a shiny.$(p)$(o)Shiny Pokémon are not more powerful.
book.cobblepedia.entries.shiny_stone.evo: The $(l)Shiny Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.shiny_stone.tex: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It shines with a dazzling light.
book.cobblepedia.entries.shiny_stone_blo: Is a $(l:shiny_stone)shiny stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
book.cobblepedia.entries.shiny_stone_ore: Commonly found on Floral, Magical and Sky biomes and rarely found on Island and Peak biomes.
These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop a $(l:shiny_stone)shiny stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
Two Pokémon can mount the player's shoulders.

Some small Pokémon have the ability to mount the player's shoulder. A select few of these can grant the user effects.$(br)A Pokémon can be placed on the player's shoulder by using the interact menu, which can be brought up by interacting with the Pokémon while sneaking.
A list, on the official Cobblemon wiki, of all Pokémon that can mount player's shoulders and their effects.
book.cobblepedia.entries.silk_scarf.hold: A $(l)Silk Scarf$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Normal-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.silk_scarf.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a sumptuous scarf that boosts the power of the holder's Normal-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.silver_powder.h: When held, Silver Powder raises the power of Bug-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.silver_powder.t: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a shiny silver powder that boosts the power of the holder's Bug-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.skull_fossil.te: $(l)Skull Fossil$() is a $(l:fossil)fossil$() that can be revived into $(pokemon)Cranidos$() when placed in a fully assembled $(l:resurrection_machine)Resurrection Machine$(). Can be found in: $(l:prehistoric_birch_tree)Birch Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_mossy_pond)Mossy Pond$(), $(l:prehistoric_mud_pit)Mud Pit$(), $(l:prehistoric_oak_tree)Oak Tree$(), $(l:prehistoric_suspicious_mound)Suspicious Mound$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.sky_tumblestone: $(l)Sky tumblestone$() is the sky $(l:tumblestones)tumblestone$() variant. Becomes a $(l:sky_tumblestone_cluster)sky tumblestone bud$() when placed.
$(l)Block of sky tumblestone$() is the sky $(l:tumblestone_blocks)tumblestone block$() variant.
$(l)Sky Tumblestone Brick Slab$() is one of the $(l:tumblestone_brick_slabs)tumblestone brick slabs$().
$(l)Sky Tumblestone Brick Stairs$() is one of the $(l:tumblestone_bricks_stairs)tumblestone brick stairs$().
$(l)Sky Tumblestone Brick Wall$() is one of the $(l:tumblestone_brick_walls)tumblestone brick walls$().
$(l)Sky Tumblestone Bricks$() is one of the $(l:tumblestones_bricks)tumblestone bricks$().
$(l)Sky tumblestone cluster$() is the sky $(l:tumblestone_clusters)tumblestone cluster$() variant. Drops $(l:sky_tumblestone)sky tumblestones$() when fully grown.
book.cobblepedia.entries.slate_ball.craf: As with the other 6 $(l:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l), it is relatively easy to make, requiring 4 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(/l) and a copper ingot to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.slate_ball.text: A Slate Ball is one of the 7 $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l) needed for the A Full Palette advancement.$(br)It is one of the 5 original Poké Balls created for Cobblemon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.slate_rod.name: Slate Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.slate_rod.text: Is a $(l:slate_ball)slate ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.smithing_templa: Smithing Templates can be found randomly in $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chests$() found within $(l:ruin_structure)ruin structures$(). They can also be found in ruin structures within $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Block)Suspicious Blocks$() in $(l:fallen_statue_ruins)Fallen Statue Ruins$().

$(l)Smithing Templates$() are items that are used in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Smithing_Table)smithing tables$() to alter the visuals or upgrade tools and armor. They are consumed upon use but can be duplicated using an existing template, the materials for the template, and diamonds.
book.cobblepedia.entries.smoke_ball.obta: This item is currently unobtainable in survival and can only be obtained via creative or cheats.
book.cobblepedia.entries.smoke_ball.text: A $(l)Smoke Ball$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that guarantees the holder can flee from wild Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.smooth_rock.loo: Smooth Rocks can be found within $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$() inside of $(l:prehistoric_eroded_pillar)Prehistoric Eroded Pillars$(), $(l:prehistoric_sandy_den)Prehistoric Sandy Dens$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_den)Prehistoric Sunscorched Dens$(), $(l:prehistoric_sunscorched_remains)Prehistoric Sunscorched Remains$() $(l:structures)structures$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.smooth_rock.tex: A $(l)Smooth Rock$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that extends the duration of sandstorms when held, increasing its duration from 5 turns to 8 turns.
book.cobblepedia.entries.soft_sand.holdi: $(l)Soft Sand$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Ground-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.soft_sand.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a loose, silky sand that boosts the power of the holder's Ground-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.soothe_bell.tex: $(l)Soothe Bell$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that increases the holder's amount of friendship earned by 50%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.spawnallpokemon: Used to spawn one of every available Pokémon at the command user's position.$(p)$(warning)Warning: This may slow down the game for low-end computers.$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.spawnpokemon_co: Used to spawn a specified Pokémon at the command user's position.
$(c)/spawnpokemon <pokemon> [attributes]$()$(p)Alias: $(c)/pokespawn$()$(p)Example: $(c:/spawnpokemon abra shiny ability=synchronize)$(c)/spawnpokemon abra shiny ability=synchronize$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.spawnpokemonat_: Used to spawn a specified Pokémon at the specified coordinates.
$(c)/spawnpokemonat <x> <y> <z> <pokemon> [attributes]$()$(p)Example: $(c:/spawnpokemonat ~ ~ ~ abra shiny ability=synchronize)$(c)/spawnpokemonat ~ ~ ~ abra shiny ability=synchronize$()
book.cobblepedia.entries.spell_tag.holdi: A $(l)Spell Tag$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Ghost-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.spell_tag.text: An item to be held by a Pokémon. It's a sinister, eerie tag that boosts the power of the holder's Ghost-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sport_ball.craf: Unlike first tier Poké Balls, Sport Balls require an iron ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sport_ball.text: A Sport Ball is a second tier Poké Ball.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sport_rod.name: Sport Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.sport_rod.text: Is a $(l:sport_ball)sport ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.star_sweet.text: A star-shaped sweet. When a $(pokemon)Milcery$() holds this, it spins around happily.
book.cobblepedia.entries.steel_gem.text: $(l)Steel Gem$() is the Steel type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sticky_barb.tex: $(l)Sticky Barb$() are a $(l:held_items)held item$() that 12.5%% of the holder's maximum health to the holder at the end of each turn, but swaps holder upon contact.
book.cobblepedia.entries.stopbattle_comm: Used to stop a specified player's current $(l:cobblepedia:battling)battle$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.strawberry_swee: A strawberry-shaped sweet. When a $(pokemon)Milcery$() holds this, it spins around happily.
book.cobblepedia.entries.stripped_aprico: Stripped apricorn logs can be obtained by using an axe on apricorn logs.
Stripped apricorn wood can be obtained by using an axe on an apricorn wood block.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sun_stone.evolv: The $(l)Sun Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.sun_stone.text: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It burns as red as the evening sun.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sun_stone_block: Is a $(l:sun_stone)sun stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sun_stone_ore.g: Commonly found on Badlands, Dripstone and Grassland biomes and rarely found on Desert and Tropical biomes.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sun_stone_ore.t: These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop a $(l:sun_stone)sun stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.super_potion.te: A $(l)Super Potion$() is a type of $(l:brew#potion)HP-restoring medicine$() that restores 100 HP when used on a Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.superb_remedy.t: A $(l)Superb Remedy$() is a type of $(l:medicine)medicine$() that restores 150 HP whilst reducing Friendship when used on a Pokémon.
A $(l)Surprise Mulch$() is a $(l:mulch)mulch$() that increases the chances for a $(l:berry_mutating)mutation of a Berry$() on the $(l:berry_tree)Berry Tree$() for 3 harvests. It can also mutate a fully grown $(l:revival_herb)Revival Herb$() into another $(l:herb)herb$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.suspicious_sher: Can be found buried inside: $(l:deserted_house_ruins)Deserted House$(), $(l:hidden_bunker_ruins)Hidden Bunker$(), $(l:unstable_cave_ruins)Unstable Cave$()
Suspicious variation of the $(l:pottery_sherd)Pokémon-themed pottery sherds$().
The Suspicious pottery sherd is in reference to $(pokemon)Ditto$() and its ability to Transform into objects.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sweet.text: $(l)Sweets$() are $(l:evolution_items)evolution items$() that can be used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Milcery$() into $(pokemon)Alcremie$(). This consumes the Sweet. The form of $(pokemon)Alcremie$() depends on the time of day.
book.cobblepedia.entries.sweet_apple.tex: A peculiar apple that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It's exceptionally sweet.
book.cobblepedia.entries.swift_feather.t: $(l)Swift Feather$() is one of the 6 $(l:feather)EV boosting feathers$() that increases a Pokémon's Speed EV when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.takepokemon_com: Used to remove a Pokémon from a specified player's party.
book.cobblepedia.entries.tart_apple.text: A peculiar apple that can make a certain species of Pokémon evolve. It's exceptionally tart.
book.cobblepedia.entries.teach_command.t: Used to teach a specified move to a Pokémon in a specified slot in a specified player's party.
book.cobblepedia.entries.terrain_extende: A $(l)Terrain Extender$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that increases the duration of the holder's moves and abilities which create terrain to 8 turns.
book.cobblepedia.entries.throat_spray.te: A $(l)Throat Spray$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that increases the holder's special attack by one stage when they use a sound-based move. This consumes the item until the end of the battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.thunder_stone.e: The $(l)Thunder Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.thunder_stone.t: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It has a distinct thunderbolt pattern.
book.cobblepedia.entries.thunder_stone_b: Is a $(l:thunder_stone)thunder stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
book.cobblepedia.entries.thunder_stone_o: Commonly found on Highlands and Hills biomes and rarely found on Jungle, Thermal and Tropical biomes.
These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop a $(l:thunder_stone)thunder stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.timer_ball.craf: Unlike first and second tier Poké Balls, Timer Balls require a gold ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.timer_ball.text: A Timer Ball is a third tier Poké Ball.$(br)Like most Poké Balls, its catch rate can change drastically under specific conditions.
book.cobblepedia.entries.timer_rod.name: Timer Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.timer_rod.text: Is a $(l:timer_ball)timer ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.timid_mint.text: $(l)Timid Mint$() is a $(l)mint$() which changes the effects of a Pokémon's $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Nature)nature$() to increase it's Speed stat and decrease it's Attack stat, making it act as if the Pokémon had the Timid nature.
book.cobblepedia.entries.toppled_pillars: $(l)Toppled Pillars$() are structures found in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Forest)Forest$() biomes in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). These structures are instead a collection of random, smaller structures, with each having either $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Gravel)Suspicious Gravel$(), $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chests$() and $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chests$(), or neither. These structures are unique in that the Rare lootpool is not guaranteed.
book.cobblepedia.entries.toxic_orb.text: A $(l)Toxic Orb$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that badly poisons its holder at the end of the turn.
book.cobblepedia.entries.trading.text: You can $(l)trade$() Pokémon by pressing $(k:cobblemon.summary) while looking at another player.
book.cobblepedia.entries.trading_evoluti: Those are $(l:evolution_items)evolution items$() that can be used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() certain Pokémon when traded or when using a $(l:link_cable)Link Cable$() while it $(l:held_items)holds$() that item.
book.cobblepedia.entries.tumblestone.tex: $(l)Tumblestone$() is the regular $(l:tumblestones)tumblestone$() variant. Becomes a $(l:tumblestone_cluster)tumblestone bud$() when placed.
book.cobblepedia.entries.tumblestone_blo: $(l)Block of Tumblestone$() is the regular $(l:tumblestone_blocks)tumblestone block$() variant.
Can be crafted using 9 of their respective $(l:tumblestones)tumblestones$().

$(l)Tumblestone blocks$() are decorative $(l:items)blocks$() and has 3 variants: $(l:tumblestone_block)tumblestone block$(), $(l:black_tumblestone_block)black tumblestone block$() and $(l:sky_tumblestone_block)sky tumblestone block$().
Used to craft 9 of their respective $(l:tumblestones)tumblestones$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.tumblestone_bri: $(l)Tumblestone Brick Slab$() is one of the $(l:tumblestone_brick_slabs)tumblestone brick slabs$().
$(l)Tumblestone Brick Stairs$() is one of the $(l:tumblestone_bricks_stairs)tumblestone brick stairs$().
$(l)Tumblestone Brick Wall$() is one of the $(l:tumblestone_brick_walls)tumblestone brick walls$().
$(l)Tumblestone Bricks$() is one of the $(l:tumblestones_bricks)tumblestone bricks$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.tumblestone_clu: $(l)Tumblestone cluster$() is the regular $(l:tumblestone_clusters)tumblestone cluster$() variant. Drops $(l:tumblestone)tumblestones$() when fully grown.

Obtained by placing and mining their respective $(l:tumblestones)tumblestone variant$() as a $(l:items)block$() and mining it with any tool with the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Silk_Touch)Silk Touch$() enchantment.

$(l)Tumblestone cluster$() are harvestable $(l:items)blocks$() similar to $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Amethyst_Cluster)amethyst clusters$() and has 3 variants: $(l:tumblestone_cluster)tumblestone cluster$(), $(l:black_tumblestone_cluster)black tumblestone cluster$() and $(l:sky_tumblestone_cluster)sky tumblestone cluster$().

Can be used to create more of their respective $(l:tumblestones)tumblestone$() when harvested while fully grown into a cluster. Only grows when placed next to a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Lava)lava$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Magma_Block)magma$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.tumblestones.ob: Tumblestone can be found as loot inside of $(l:ruin_structure)ruin structures$(). It can also be obtained by mining a $(l:tumblestone_clusters)tumblestone cluster$(), yielding 1 if not fully grown or 4 if fully grown.
book.cobblepedia.entries.tumblestones.te: A $(l)tumblestone$() is a crystal ore that can grows in a variety of colors. They are used to craft most $(l:ancient_balls)Ancient Poké Balls$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.tumblestones.us: Tumblestone can be farmed by placing the tumblestone on a block and placing $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Lava)lava$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Magma_Block)magma$() within a 3x3x3 cube around the bud. $(l:tumblestone_clusters)tumblestone clusters$(). Mining a bud before it has fully grown yields 1 tumblestone, whereas a fully grown cluster will yield 4 tumblestone.$(br2)Can also be used as an ingredient to craft $(l:tumblestone_blocks)tumblestone blocks$() or $(l:ancient_balls)ancient Poké balls$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.twisted_spoon.h: A $(l)Twisted Spoon$() is a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's Psychic-type moves by 20%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.twisted_spoon.t: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This spoon is imbued with telekinetic energy and boosts the power of the holder's Psychic-type moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.type_boosting_i: Those are $(l:held_items)held items$() that when held by a Pokémon, it boost moves of a specific type.
book.cobblepedia.entries.type_gem.name: Type Gems
book.cobblepedia.entries.type_gem.obtain: Type Gems can be found in any $(l:ruin_structure)ruin structure$(), both in chests and in $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/suspicious_sand)suspicious sand$() and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/suspicious_gravel)gravel$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.type_gem.text: $(l)Type Gems$() are $(l:held_items)held items$() which increases the power of the respective move type used by 30%%. This can only activate once per battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ultra_ball.craf: Unlike first and second tier Poké Balls, Ultra Balls require a gold ingot and a specific pattern of multi-colored apricorns to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ultra_ball.text: An Ultra Ball is a third tier Poké Ball.$(br)It functions as a direct upgrade to the Great Ball, as it has a higher static catch rate.
book.cobblepedia.entries.ultra_rod.name: Ultra Rod
book.cobblepedia.entries.ultra_rod.text: Is a $(l:ultra_ball)ultra ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.unique_forms.mi: These forms are specifically themed around Minecraft and usually include some aspect of Minecraft in their design.
book.cobblepedia.entries.unique_forms.of: These forms have appeared in Pokémon media in some shape or form, whether it be from the anime, video games or manga, but have not appeared in the Modern mainline games.
book.cobblepedia.entries.unique_forms.te: Various $(l:pokemon)Pokémon$() may appear in $(l)forms unique to Cobblemon$(). These forms vary in conditions and are purely visual; no stats, typing or movesets are changed for these differing forms.
book.cobblepedia.entries.unremarkable_te: Unremarkable Teacups can be found within $(l:ruin_structure)Ruin structures$() as Suspicious Block loot in $(l:crumbling_arch_ruins)Crumbling Arch Ruins$(), $(l:deserted_house_ruins)Deserted House Ruins$(), $(l:hidden_bunker_ruins)Hidden Bunker Ruins$() or $(l:toppled_pillars_ruins)Toppled Pillars Ruins$().

An $(l)Unremarkable Teacup$() is one of the $(l:evolution_items)evolution items$() that is used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() Counterfeit Form $(pokemon)Poltchageist$() into Unremarkable Form $(pokemon)Sinistcha$() when used.
book.cobblepedia.entries.unstable_cave_r: The structure is built in a way to make the player carefully support blocks in this structure and brush what they can without causing the unstable blocks to fall. All $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Suspicious_Sand)Suspicious Sand$() is intentionally placed on either the pillars or the ceiling of the cave. The cave also generates $(l:relic_coin_pouch)Relic Coin Pouches$().

$(l)Unstable Cave$() are structures found in any biome containing $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Sand)Sand$(), not including $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Red_Sand)Red Sand$() or $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Beach)Beaches$(), in the $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Overworld)Overworld$(). The structure contains 4 chests; a $(l:gimmighoul_chest)Gimmighoul Chest$(), a $(l:gilded_chest)Gilded Chest$(), a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Chest)normal Chest$() and a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Trapped_Chest)Trapped Chest$() which will cause the entire cave to collapse.
book.cobblepedia.entries.upgrade.evolvin: An $(l)Upgrade$() is an item that is used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Porygon$() into $(pokemon)Porygon2$() when held while using a $(l:cobblepedia:link_cable)link cable$(). This consumes the Upgrade.
book.cobblepedia.entries.upgrade.text: A transparent device somehow filled with all sorts of data. It was produced by Silph Co.
book.cobblepedia.entries.using_evolution: Those are $(l:evolution_items)evolution items$() that can be used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() certain Pokémon. This consumes the Item.
book.cobblepedia.entries.utility_umbrell: A $(l)Utility Umbrella$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() which causes the holder to be unaffected by the effects of rain and harsh sunlight.
book.cobblepedia.entries.verdant_ball.cr: As with the other 6 $(l:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l), it is relatively easy to make, requiring 4 like-color $(l:apricorn)apricorns$(/l) and a copper ingot to craft.
book.cobblepedia.entries.verdant_ball.te: A Verdant Ball is one of the 7 $(l:cobblepedia:basic_balls)basic Poké Balls$(/l) needed for the A Full Palette advancement.$(br)It is one of the 5 original Poké Balls created for Cobblemon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.verdant_rod.tex: Is a $(l:verdant_ball)verdant ball$() themed $(l:pokerod)Poké Rod$() (visual only).
book.cobblepedia.entries.village_pokecen: $()Poké Centers$() are buildings that appears commonly in each type of Village. Equipped with a special $(l:healing_machine)Healing Machine$() (that if you try to collect it, it only drops iron; no cheesing progression here, bud) that can be used to give a villager the $(l:nurse_villager)nurse$() profession.
book.cobblepedia.entries.vitamin.text: $(l)Vitamins$() are $(l:medicine)medicines$() that can be used on a Pokémon to increase the base points of one of it's stats.
book.cobblepedia.entries.vivichoke.obtai: Vivichokes are obtained by harvesting the final stage of a $(l:vivichoke_seeds)vivichoke crop$(), which produces one vivichoke.
book.cobblepedia.entries.vivichoke.text: $(l)Vivichoke$() is a rare $(l:items)item$() only obtained by harvesting vivichoke crops grown from $(l:vivichoke_seeds)vivichoke seeds$(). The main use of it is to increase potency of a $(l:medicine)Medicine$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.vivichoke_dip.t: $(l)Vivichoke Dip$() is a $(l:food)food$() item that can be eaten by the player to restore 10 hunger points and 12 saturation, as well as $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Absorption)Absorption$() I for 30 seconds.
book.cobblepedia.entries.vivichoke_seeds: Placing vivichoke seeds into a $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Composter)composter$() has a 65%% chance of raising the compost level by 1.

Vivichoke seeds can be placed on farmland. After being placed, it goes through eight stages of growth.$(br)When bone meal is used on a vivichoke crop, its growth stage will increase by one.$(br)Breaking the final stage produces one $(l:vivichoke)vivichoke$(). If they are harvested early, they drop one seed without any vivichoke.

$(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Monster_Room)Monster rooms$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Mineshaft)Mineshafts$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Jungle_pyramid)Jungle pyramids$(), $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Village)Village$() houses, and $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Shipwreck)Shipwreck$() supply chests may contain vivichoke seeds in stacks of 1-3.

$(l)Vivichoke seeds$() are $(l:items)items$() that can be used to grow $(l:vivichoke)vivichoke$() crops found through wandering traders, Farmer villager trades, Village houses, and certain structure's chests.
Vivichoke seeds are sold by $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Wandering_Trader)wandering traders$() and Journeyman-level farmer $(l:https://minecraft.wiki/w/Villager)villagers$() for 24 emeralds.
book.cobblepedia.entries.water_gem.text: $(l)Water Gem$() is the Water type variation of a $(l:type_gem)type gem$().$(br2)It will have additional uses later, so you should start collecting it.
book.cobblepedia.entries.water_stone.evo: The $(l)Water Stone$() causes the following Pokémon to $(l:evolution)evolve$():
book.cobblepedia.entries.water_stone.tex: A peculiar $(l:evolution_stone)stone$() that can make certain species of Pokémon $(l:evolution)evolve$(). It is the clear blue of a deep pool.
book.cobblepedia.entries.water_stone_blo: Is a $(l:water_stone)water stone$() $(l:evolution_stone_block)evolution stone block$() variant.
book.cobblepedia.entries.water_stone_ore: Commonly found on Ocean, River and Swamp biomes and rarely found on Jungle, Thermal and Tropical biomes.
These are $(l:evolution_stone_ore)evolution stone ores$() that drop a $(l:water_stone)water stone$() when $(l:evolution_stone_mining)mined$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.weakness_policy: $(l)Weakness Policy$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that raises the holder's Attack and Special Attack by two stages when hit by a super-effective move. This can only activate once per battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.whipped_dream.e: A $(l)Whipped Dream$() is an item that is used to $(l:evolution)evolve$() $(pokemon)Swirlix$() into $(pokemon)Slurpuff$() when held while using a $(l:cobblepedia:link_cable)link cable$(). This consumes the Whipped Dream.
book.cobblepedia.entries.whipped_dream.t: A soft and sweet treat made of fluffy, puffy, whipped, and whirled cream. It's loved by a certain Pokémon.
book.cobblepedia.entries.white_gilded_ch: A $(l)White Gilded Chest$() is the $(l:white_apricorn)white apricorn$() $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn#colors)color$() variation of a $(l:gilded_chest)gilded chest$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.white_herb.text: A $(l)White Herb$() is a $(l:herb)herb$() that restores all of the holder's decreased stats. It will be consumed after use.
book.cobblepedia.entries.white_herb.usag: A White Herb restores all of the holder's decreased stats. For example, if the holder uses $(l:https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Shell_Smash)Shell Smash$(), the White Herb will activate and the decreased Defense and Special Defense stats will be restored.
book.cobblepedia.entries.white_mint_leaf: $(l)White Mint Leaf$() is a $(l:mint_leaf)mint leaf$() that can neutralize a the Pokémon's stats. Grows from $(l:white_mint_seeds)white mint seeds$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.white_mint_seed: $(l)White Mint Seeds$() are $(l:mint_seeds)mint seeds$() that are used to grow $(l:white_mint_leaf)white mint leaves$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.wide_lens.text: A $(l)Wide Lens$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that boosts the holder's accuracy by 10%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.wise_glasses.ho: $(l)Wise Glasses$() are a $(l:cobblepedia:held_items)held item$() that boosts the power of the holder's special moves by 10%%.
book.cobblepedia.entries.wise_glasses.te: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This thick pair of glasses slightly boosts the power of the holder's special moves.
book.cobblepedia.entries.x_accuracy.text: An $(l)X Accuracy$() is an $(l:x_item)x item$() that raises the target's accuracy stat by one stage when used in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.x_attack.text: An $(l)X Attack$() is an $(l:x_item)x item$() that raises the target's attack stat by one stage when used in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.x_defense.text: An $(l)X Defense$() is an $(l:x_item)x item$() that raises the target's defense stat by one stage when used in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.x_item.text: An $(l)X Item$() is an $(l:medicine)medicine$() that raises one of the target's stats by one stage when used in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.x_special_attac: An $(l)X Special Attack$() is an $(l:x_item)x item$() that raises the target's special attack stat by one stage when used in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.x_special_defen: An $(l)X Special Defense$() is an $(l:x_item)x item$() that raises the target's special defense stat by one stage when used in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.x_speed.text: An $(l)X Speed$() is an $(l:x_item)x item$() that raises the target's speed stat by one stage when used in battle.
book.cobblepedia.entries.yellow_gilded_c: A $(l)Yellow Gilded Chest$() is the $(l:yellow_apricorn)yellow apricorn$() $(l:cobblepedia:apricorn#colors)color$() variation of a $(l:gilded_chest)gilded chest$().
book.cobblepedia.entries.zinc.text: A $(l)Zinc$() is a $(l:vitamin)medicine$() that adds 10 Special Defense EVs to a Pokémon when used if possible (up to a maximum of 100).
book.cobblepedia.entries.zoom_lens.text: A $(l)Zoom Lens$() is a $(l:held_items)held item$() that boosts the holder's accuracy by 20%% against targets which have already used a move in the same turn.
book.cobblepedia.landing_text: Cobblemon: The Pokémon mod for everyone that aims to integrate much better into modpacks and Minecraft itself than other Pokémon mods.
book.cobblepedia.pages.ingredient.text: Can be used to craft the above item(s)
book.cobblepedia.pages.loot.title: Loot
book.cobblepedia.pages.structure.title: Structure
book.cobblepedia.pages.variants.title: Variants
book.cobblepedia.subtitle: All about Cobblemon
